YyR5dOfFyZcHtUDCO78eEg.text: This place had some of the best pumpkin pancakes ever! The eggs were a little under cooked and the hashbrowns looked gross. The coconut chicken and waffles were tasty!

3wMDIJ3BW7WNTJPiTCQB_A.text: We are from Hawaii and decided to try this place which I googled and was pleasantly surprised how good the employees and the food are.  Friendly employees and efficient too.  Food didn't  take long to come.  They never wasted time to refill our coffee and to take away our plates which was done to keep the table clean.  As we say in Hawaii, Mahalo (thank you) for making our day.

ewfxGpD5SGBX5LdM6Ps3bQ.text: It was pretty crowded and the food was okay. I probably should have ordered something different because my plate wasn't very good. I had the blueberry hill scramble. The cheese they used in it would have been better if it was cheddar cheese. They used sliced sand which cheese. They did the same for the omelette my son ordered. He wasn't impressed either. The pancakes were good. Next time I'm in Vegas I will try them again to see if we just made poor ordering choices.

y_5zGk6X2OFVoZi1G_Ho7Q.text: Great selection of American, Mexican style breakfasts and other kinds too. My favorite is simple grilled cheese sandwich on sour dough if I have a carb craving. I like the cozy environment of a diner here plus they have a nice mini bar you can get cocktails and food to eat as well. They offer plenty of cakes and bakery options and also one unique thing is they make there own fudge which is great if you have a sweet tooth! Prices are moderate. Staff is very friendly even on late night shifts. Big portions.

vxsF2uFaTJDkXB248D34ng.text: Yum! The food was great!  Like a better version of dennys or Ihop, just be prepared for a wait!  Crepes were great,  would love to go back!

bM-B3CWMWkaADFY_kCQ9Cg.text: Food was delicious. Wife had the breakfast tacos with chorizo instead of taco meat with a pancake. I had the waitress special, 3 strips of bacon, 2 xlarge eggs, and a Belgian waffle.  My wife and I both agree that the griddle items were the best we have ever had! Everything was better than average. While the food was very good, the service was less than average and nothing to write home about. They filled the glass with ice so you could get three sips of water and you had an empty glass, THEN, it say empty for 15 minutes. It may have just been our server. She seemed a little scattered, writing down the table number wrong on the ticket so the food was almost delivered to the wrong table, and forgetting what our drinks were not even two minutes after she asked us. A disappointing way to bring down a restaurant's rating when their food was damn good! SMH.

i_mwFbUuc6297ymc7fJbmg.text: Our family goes every time we go to Vegas. Food is great! Not expensive and portions and a great size. I am able to share a club sandwich and be full!

MMqUf8teMmzbDzSoDwSB1A.text: I love breakfast food more than anything else, and this place delivered. It was also nice to get off the strip and into a bit of "normal" Vegas. I ordered a fairly simple breakfast of biscuits and gravy, bacon, eggs, and two pancakes. The food was excellent, and the service was attentive. My only know is the price, nearly $3 for each pancake? Let's bring that down a bit.

nBhbzqWq5W2cmneQdEVebg.text: Late night just got off of work and we were hungry, so we stopped by this Blueberry Hill on the way home and because of Donald we will make this our new after work late night spot!!! His personality is infectious and he's real down to earth! His smile and small talk kept us awake and made us want to get to know him more. Thank you Donald for feeding us and keeping us awake we left happy and we will definitely be back weekly to see you! Lily you were awesome too! Thank you both so much!

zaYa4mTRzNYDAqwKrNgshw.text: The blueberry pancakes were very good my girlfriend said there was something off about her eggs Benedict   Very good Service. Kinda pricey

cHbKyLK7W80EtirgMjfc3w.text: Another great Breakfast. Portions are huge! Order breakfast, it's enough for lunch and dinner

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow!

lJjXVcMt1IYXGVbfzcuS5w.text: Save your money! My family and I went for lunch and the food stinks. I had a waffle and it was absolutely plain and small, for $9.00! My had band had an omelette and it was dry. I had found coupons online so when it was time to pay the very angry Hispanic manager came out shouting that's not her website and she doesn't take coupons. She was the worst "manager" I have ever encountered. I will definitely never go back.

WMrF43wwPAwZ3Y0oYzf_Cw.text: Just moved to Vegas. Been here few times. Today 9 of us went in for breakfast and Cesar was our server. A friend mentioned it was me/my partner's 27th anniversary and Cesar was extremely amazing and kind. He was so respectful and really embraced that it was our anniversary. That says a lot in today's world. I wish more people could be like Cesar. Not to mention the level of service he provides to the guests. Thank you Cesar.

iPjWfFSRHTTSDWFcMUu7UA.text: Great service. Denver Omelette was so good. Donald was great with his service. A must go to place if you want exceptional food and service.

oilzKsVXNujPAXKlL2xEVA.text: I would only go here for the pie. The coconut cream pie is delicious!! I would imagine that all the other pies are just as good.

tFA99DJwFwEHs8OeIfNUbg.text: This restaurant is hands down the Best in Las Vegas and only 5min from the strip.  They not only have excellent customer service but their food is to die for!  They have huge portions on everything from their homemade breakfast to dinner..also you need not try their cakes..like heaven!  My favorite place to eat in Vegas!! Go eat here if your hungry you're belly will be happy you did!

qVGc-6any09-JGPYcDDASg.text: Another location, another great breakfast. Some of the tastiest corn beef hash I've had.

kz2nwQUV5JqZ45ZzSNwLmA.text: The pork chops I got definetly weren't grilled fresh, they were just reheated . The sauce on them was too much,  like trying to hide the taste of the meet , hide the fact meet wasn't tasting fresh . Inexpensive place with Mediocre food

8jkw7xkP6OKcA4IlOCtvTg.text: Great family feel restaurant. The food is about $8-$13 for a meal. We went for breakfast and loved it! I had the Oreo pancakes which were delicious but a little too sweet for breakfast. Fast service and our server Nix was amazing. Super nice and always kept our drinks full. Great experience and would go back!

ek7WvJKrqT6SbXD6LZXqiA.text: Horrible just horrible. Wish I could give no stars. Definitely NOT up to Blueberry hill standards. The server is the ONLY thing Positive. Tammy was friendly but when her crew can't back her up she can't do her job. Spoke to manager about these issues didn't seem to really care. He said the right things but ga e me the right right right and pushed me along.

3lQD94pJPuBedVEEDppyxg.text: Great Bakery and breakfast place. Went here with a group of people and we all loved our meals. Their prices and portions are great. Another good place to go for cheap eats.

ZDLwgDZwMI_l46_uiqqd_w.text: First time In Vegas and this was our first stop . We had never ate here before so we didn't know what to expect. Our server was so nice and our food got to us fast . I ordered a patty melt and fries and it was sooo good! Blue berry muffins are delicious . Would definitely come back when I'm in town again!

6WRctVGfe4itmpBxVFr4yA.text: Sometimes you just want pancakes for dinner, and Blueberry Hill has always served me well, whereas the offerings at most other 24/7 breakfast joints haven't quite done that. I've long been a fan of the fruit compote pancakes, and the pancakes here are always absolutely massive, around 7" dia. Fluffy, not needlessly sweet on their own, and superb with blueberries baked inside.  Understandably, mileage may vary, but I can't recall having a bad experience with the service here.  This place used to be a Marie Callender's, so rather than the neon blue glow that is characteristic of the other Blueberry Hill restaurants, you'll find that the country home aesthetic still remains.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple Pancakes
Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Pancakes (front), Blueberry Pancakes

sSxOKc_I_oZXpCUxwNP-mw.text: Cute little busy restaurant with lots of great breakfast foods.  Had the Eggs Benedict with potato cakes.  All good food worth the money.

9NvQJI64rMf8RodaTVSCRQ.text: I was recently in Vegas for a car show and we needed something to eat that was close to where we were staying. We found Blueberry less than a mile away with lots of parking available. The restaurant was nice inside and larger than it appeared. There was a nice menu of mostly typical diner fare but that was exactly what we were looking for. Dinner was great, prices were very good and service was great. we liked it so much we ended up coming back for breakfast the next morning and loved it even more. Breakfast is definitely their strong suite and we enjoyed every bite, can't wait till next year, Aloha

HS-xHRtHYsOALJuDbxES8g.text: Love this place.  Service is excellent.  Food is better than IHOP or Denny's and similar breakfast places.  And its 24/7!  The muffins are awesome.  You can also order them grilled which added an extra dimension to their already delicious muffins.  The topping on the muffin tops are so good.  Apple pancakes also very good and you get A LOT of them!  Light and fluffy with just the right amount of sweet.  The only weird thing I found was that they serve the cooked and raw apples with the rinds on.  It didn't really add any value to the apple taste.  The cheese burger was very good too.  They boast never frozen, 100% angus beef.  Whatever it was, it was juicy and flavorful and cooked perfectly.  I do wish they seasoned it more, however, I guess they need to cater to a broad spectrum of tastes.  When we left, I noticed their display for ribs.  THEY SERVE IT ON A BAKING SHEET!!! Whoa!  Going to have to try it!  Lol and split it among 2-3 people!

Care for children or just having breakfast or lunch again so many options must go

Everything is made from scratch daily including the thick slices of baked bread. This french toast reigns superior along with its ingredients. #madefreshdaily #madefromscratch

Cx9FCys0Ns9I0seHAaJ8xw.text: Lots of delicious home cooking! Today I had spaghetti and meatballs chicken noodle soup and brought home a slice of strberry cake! Fantastic!!

Gye5-jfG_m8pvIdYYANjtQ.text: Enjoy coming here for breakfast anytime of the day. The location is easy to access. The service is pretty slow and the workers could be a bit more friendly.

m_U00QCYMy8beBJOSQegsQ.text: I am a little torn, the service was a little hit and miss, or maybe it was my server.  I didn't get what I ordered or how I ordered it, I asked to have one poached egg added to one of the quarters of my chicken and waffles, it came without it, and after I asked her she brought one poached egg in a cup full of water, I tried to scoop it to put in on top of my chicken because I didn't want all that water on my dish but I was impossible, it ended up bursting in the water.  The manager noticed and immediately told her to bring me a new dish.  My husband was almost done with his breakfast by then.  My new dish came but my mimosa failed to come until the end of my meal.  The food is ok, some items like my husband's are pretty good, but I guess service depends on who you get.

1jzPpahwSHgRiynvWXP2BQ.text: An excellent place for breakfast!  It appears this is a 24 hour restaurant so probably their entire menu would be superb. If your hungry this is the place to be very large and generous portions!  Clean and wait staff friendly and helpful.

-lMuSs5zXcFUd1bKtKdmFw.text: great diner. fast service. yummy food. glad i tried the chicken with waffle.

Klgq1hroK7zE1ohlbCVFJg.text: This is usually one of my foot breakfast spots. I always get the French toast. If they are on it  I ask for well done and it has a nice lil crunch. Otherwise when they are busy they may mess  that up. Often times there's a line and to be completely honest the young lady at the bar is a better server anyway. She's in touch with her customers and engaged. This place is an upgraded version to a classic spot. Tv's all over the place. No neighborhood feel

MYIrcLo4cfenWOxQ7_O1_g.text: This is their newest location. I think it's also their best. Why? Well because there is a bar in this one. You can order drinks or sit at the bar (breakfast mimosas!) and watch tv during your meal. This location is not far from the strip.  I grew up on the deliciousness that is Blueberry Hill. It honestly was a staple of my childhood here in Vegas. I've never had a bad meal or had anything I did not like.  Breakfast is usually where I stay at on the menu. I've had lunch and I've had dinner. Both also good, the breakfast is what brings me back. Especially since it's offered 24/7. Their pancakes are the BEST in town hands down. Made from scratch, not a box. Served with warm syrup and real whipped butter. It's carb heaven. I'm also in love with their thick cut delicious sourdough toast. It pairs with everything from a BLT to dipping in my eggs over easy.  The menu ranges from traditional breakfast options, Mexican breakfast and all kinds of great sugar stuff. You know waffles and stuffed French toast. Then there is lunch and dinner options. And if you hadn't noticed on your walk through the entrance, they do homemade desserts that make you wanna lick the window they're being shown off in.  Seating options are booth, tables and chairs, 1//2 booth 1/2 table & chairs or the bar. So they a good for large parties too.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dealer&#39;s special. Bone in ham, eggs and I wanted fries instead of potatoes. Grilled jalapeño and side of homemade ranch in the background.

cplpFAvn5SQgTousxdYIXg.text: My Mom and I ate here tonight. We opted for Blueberry Hill instead of TGI Friday's at the Orleans. So glad we did! I had read the reviews and gave it a shot. Everything was homemade from scratch, the portions were excellent, everything we were served was fantastic, the prices were very affordable for the average person, and even though the server Alyssa was busy and stressed, she still gave great service and took the time to clearly answer a couple questions about the food rather than scoughing and being rude. Over all a fantastic experience and we will definitely be back.

cq5LY2a45ADk7ZvsFErVzQ.text: Used to love this place but they're ridiculous now! A shake is $5+$3 extra for blueberry even tho blueberries are cheap as 70 cents a pint right now! Then if you see the pic of the grilled cheese that isn't grilled (what a joke) for $10 - also no kids menu after 10pm?! Overpriced & not very good quality / This place went WAY down - nvr again

xKI57AHg4PZi6n8HHBL2Lg.text: Poor service and crappy food. Let me preface this by saying not all blueberry hill locations are like this. I've tried other locations and had amazing food and service. I've given this location a few chances and it just sucks. The last time was the worst. We came in at night around 11 pm and 4 employees were at the front and all of them were on their phones and ignoring us, they definitely noticed we were there but just stood and looked at us and didn't acknowledge us nor seat us or get someone to seat us. What horrible service! Our orders came out wrong, the food was bland. Won't be going to this location again. Don't waste your time at this location.

36keUhDVsssmzZq2vcE9rw.text: Friendly, prompt service and great food! I recommend the bacon cheeseburger...MMMM! And for the record the patty isn't made until you order it! I had a little bit of the Denver skillet also, so good! The fries were ok, but I can look past that!

PB_ZGFzyImmoy3HeY4dYlg.text: No no no this not good I ask cried chicken breast got grilled fillet.Eggs runny u charge me 40$for  burnt undone food a breast has a bone thanks

JV4MefxXDljDdGRgAG12ug.text: Great place to have breakfast, I had chicken & waffles that I really enjoyed, truly recommend. Will definitely be back!

bBAbmISP32fi7MZKUAGNmg.text: Great place to eat large menu reasonable prices I've been going to this restaurant for many years tried all the different locations in town and never been dissatisfied.

0RcwEKekYWxvs5ZMJ_vN2A.text: Great service and huge portions. This would be 5 stars if the French toast lived up to the hype. Not nearly as thick and luscious as I expected. But the pancakes and everything else was wonderful.

9tE5dVIF2OS7nZ8xlILs1A.text: If you come on weekdays, you'll probably have a good experience, weekends not so much (since they are usually understaffed and there is one waitress that is less that friendly). Food is decent if not better than other breakfast places out there. Get the Truck Stop meatloaf special, the crepes, or any variety of pancakes. You can't go wrong. Location is where the old Marie Callendars once was. I like this place as a weekday destination.   One thing I find very strange is that they NEVER give you a receipt when you pay with cash. If you ask for a receipt they have to go in the back to make one up for you. Why don't they have cash registers that can print out receipts for cash paying customers? Why the hassle? I find that odd.

_FMHqJouj6k2hfc9olStHw.text: Omg! Blueberry "Hill?!" A more accurate name would be Home of the Glorious, Mythological, Sacred Food-Mountains. With the portion sizes, you're pretty much getting 2 (or even 3) meals for the price of one! Great value! And after my boyfriend and I finished almost everything, the waitress didn't even laugh at us or tell us about health problems that could occur from eating so much.   There was a great selection - it's not just breakfast.  The dinner meals are fantastic, also. And don't even get me started on the desserts... Great atmosphere, very clean setting, good customer service... An awesome experience overall. I'll be telling all my friends about this place :)

oeoxKGuGXtIu3hzJ2nXP6A.text: I had been searching for a good breakfast restaurant that had crepes on their menu. I had initially tried going to Cracker Barrel restaurant. BOY ! Am I glad I found this restaurant. I ordered the full house breakfast plate. I am in love! I just wished that this restaurant chain would exist in California. There are A LOT! Of breakfast choices. They are all GREAT. I know now where I will be bringing my family to have an excellent breakfast. The staff friendliness also makes it for a better experience

edjQRLlAB4F37biYWRmXxA.text: We have been to this restaurant now 4 times in two weeks, food selection ad taste is fantastic. The service is always great and place is clean, never a wait. A definite recommend for all, and we will continue to go !!!!

mHGt44x40P4G9lAUziOmtA.text: Really good place to get breakfast food if you're not looking for a dennys or IHOP. Similar food but a lot more! I love the corned beef hash omelette. You get to choose a side of potatoes or pancakes and so I chose the pancakes. I didn't know a side was 3 full sized pancakes! The omelette was huge too (4 eggs I believe). Great place to get your breakfast fix

TKGi4mS-rOYhnElLKjUQoA.text: Went in for a late night snack with my boyfriend to check this place out as it is pretty close to our home. The ambiance is pretty much what you would expect from any run of the mill dinner, nothing too exceptional. The service was quiet slow the night we went in, but the food was pretty tasty! I ordered the apple jam chicken waffles and my boyfriend got the club sandwich. Both were really tasty and a good late night snack. Blueberry hill wouldn't be my first choice for date night, but the food was decent enough to go again if it's late and options are limited.

Hubby & I are here on business/pleasure  for a few days and this is definitely where we will have breakfast every day.  Chicken & waffles.....OMG yuummm!!  Tomorrow I'm trying the Irish eggs Benedict. I can hardly wait.

wLrn4VoY23Hb9K1zEG5ukA.text: This place was so good we tried the coconut chicken and waffles, corn cakes, and the mexican style breakfast with fried eggs. Everything was good! I loved the waffle and chicken but you won't like it if you aren't into super sweet candy like chicken haha. The chips get a little soggy under everything in the mexi breakfast but everything was tasty. Server was very friendly and brought drink refills. Very busy popular spot.

U3Q5p_hmZtASSZkMd_ApuA.text: The night cooks need some training from the other Blueberry Hill down the road. Just saying. The waitress was good though.

ZUl9nR0ETQwFAltGTMrqrg.text: I've always heard good things about this place but after my visit im not quite sure about that. My family always come to this location for breakfast or lunch, but for my first time coming along to with them for the late night dinner, i'de have to say that I'm thoroughly disappointed..  The customer service was not as great as i expected compared to other locations. Our waitress was not friendly until we started complaining about the food. And speaking of the food, it was not appetizing at all! The preparation just looked like rubbish. My father ordered the Bonanza Breakfast with ham, but when we got our food, the ham was burnt hard, so of course we got it replaced, and the second time it came out there was just a bunch of burnt char on it. Also for their french toast, it was not even cooked, it was soggy and still raw i couldn't even eat it. Very unprofessional and unacceptable to serve something like that. For a great word of mouth restaurant, i was absolutely disappointed. This might be my first and last visit.

9sXCXTtt2sP-8m-zh5bFPA.text: We had the Dixie breakfast meatloaf and it was fantastic! Plus the service was friendly and fast!

h_M2IAHTkjK0gI7xwrcxCQ.text: Came here cause my husband and I were hungry and it was late. Got treated not so good by our server. Will definitely not com back to this location again. Don't know if it was because we are gay or if she was just having a bad shift but we didn't feel good about our experience.

kVIAt__twiGZP6qgutS6AA.text: Super disappointed in my breakfast this am : (. I ordered the eggs Benedict. I admit, I'm really picky about how my eggs are cooked. I especially don't enjoy when they are overcooked, and this is exactly what happened. I basically was served hard boiled eggs covered in hollandaise sauce (the sauce was delicious). There is just no excuse for this. Yes, I could have sent them back, but my boyfriend already had his food, so I didn't want to wait. He loved his food by the way. He had the pork chops. We also shared a side of biscuits and gravy and a pancake, all tasty. Not sure if I'd go back though. Service was just ok. Coffee was lukewarm at best and I didn't get a water refill.

497xnYjVLgDNxUpvlrwL9w.text: This place is amazing. The food has large portions and you can find anything you want from pancakes to steak and Eggs + everything in between. Service is quick and friendly.  Both times we visited this place there was a little wait of about 20 minutes but totally worth the wait.  Go hungry for good quality family food!

ove8D2IbqTIQq8-lAP7Q_Q.text: Love the Honey coconut chicken and waffles and the Mexican hash. I visited this place twice while staying in Vegas. I'll be back for one of those delicious looking cakes

Wbvn--THvRzeCrI3RRMwPA.text: Norma Jean is the best waitress of all time!!! She was very nice and pleasant.  She made us feel comfortable and helped us make our selection, which btw was spot on.   I had the Chicken fried chicken (but grilled) and he had the Ham and cheese omelette. Man man man the food is to die for. Although I'm not a big eater and I'm very particular when it comes to food. I must say EVERYTHING WAS FANTASTIC; the Service, the food and the atmosphere!!! Did I mention the pancakes were unbelievable!! The best I've ever had. I'm looking forward to my next visit!

The server we had took 20 minutes to take our order then brought out our food and had us wait another 5 minutes for our toast, didn't check on our drinks and when she did ask she never brought me more coffee, at the end I asked for a water and that took another 5 minutes. It was the server we had because before then my bf asked for another OJ and the server who we asked brought it immediately. I am not one to review places with bad feedback but I found it really annoying. Oh and let me say it was not busy at all she was in charge of 3 tables then at the end 4 .

uJTovUu4qsN3_-psXJ9XQg.text: Great service and even better food every time we come. Perfect little diner feel, very clean and friendly as well.

wkeZtM8IyKy1OzFsW7PnpQ.text: First time here was on St. Patty's Day! A busy day for this place but we had a great server - Bonney. She was extremely helpful in answering our questions and made sure our visit was perfect. So many wonderful items on the menu - I wish I could try them all! This is why I'll be coming back again and again. Potato pancakes were delicious! The country potatoes were so soft and tasty with Ranch dressing. Not too much seasoning and not bland. We didn't wait long either - for a holiday that is awesome. I like that the servers all help each other. They seemed to get along - at least in the public's view and that didn't go unnoticed.  I invite you to try this place - it's worth it in my opinion. So many different and unique dishes to try. Don't pass up the to die for desserts in the case to your left as you walk in.

fL5_BLz7VCrz8oXc7NnHGA.text: Our first time here and probably our last time, food was great but service could be better, there wasn't enough silverware, they forgot our orange juice, the server pour me coffee when I said no thank you but the kids soda was empty but she didn't ask if we need more soda.

b8Yl3An5Lyn52FlyU5U9IQ.text: This is our favorite breakfast place Everytime we come to Las Vegas. Outstanding customer service, awesome food and great prices. With many locations across Las Vegas and Henderson, you will always be near.

YPUegWUeUQHWtc7iJMtl4A.text: Good Traditional American Food  My dad, my younger brother and I were hanging out at the office when I started nagging them about being hungry. To shut me up they asked a colleague to recommend a place nearby and that's how we ended up at Blueberry Hill.  I ordered me bacon, eggs and coffee which hit the spot for me, but sadly I was so busy licking up my own plate that I did not even get a chance to ask my father and brother if they liked their meals! Oh well, maybe next time I won't be so self-centered!

U7fKRhHy9x8krXoJAf69Nw.text: New location for me to try for the first time and they unfortunately had a power outage but it was actually quite nice they let us finish our meal and the staff was very pleasant and of course the blueberry muffins are so good  and huge they are  a meal in themselves....

Sq44gQVOf1A5PCajy3Fr9g.text: Ordered French Toast Chefs Special! I should of gotten the bigger order with more French toast because it's so yummy.. & the potatoes are fire too. Definitely another favorite spot

qP8EUaQ4w3igDxbKTi2CuQ.text: Place was crowded but service made up for it. Waitress was very friendly and quick all requests and order. I ordered the florentine Benedict, add a side of hash. It came hot and fresh. It was nothing special, the flavors all kinda blended together, but It was above average. I ordered hash brown well done and they were cooked perfectly, most of the time places over cook them when ordered well done, not these, PERFECT! Side of hash was just food service hash, but cooked well. Only real complaint was the coffee was not to hot. I will eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W-Nd1dI5jwLS8h6EU9dHyA.text: I never had a complaint about anything. Everything I have ordered has been very good. The service was also good. Very friendly atmosphere.  I keep coming back every time I am in the mood for Blueberry Hill.

zZikPgF46KwEZO1s1MNd8Q.text: I haven't been to a Blueberry Hill in about 8 years, and after our visit on Sunday, I'm really not sure why we have waited so long to go back.    We decided to start the New Year off right, with a delicious breakfast with friends.   We arrived at about 10am, right before the big rush.  There was no wait.   The restaurant has a huge waiting area right up front.  Probably the biggest waiting area I've seen since Mimi's Cafe.   Its well lit, and very clean.    Our server was phenomenal.  I really wish I'd jotted down her name.  She was friendly.  Prompt. Super nice.  She double checked our orders, and kept our coffee cups full.   Shall I mention the PLETHORA of flavored creamers she brought out for us?  I've never had a place bring so many before, and I use a lot, so this was perfect.  I know its odd, but I love the mugs that they served the coffee in.  I have a thing for mugs, and there's just something comforting about a big, thick, sturdy mug.  They have them for sale here, and I just might have to come back and buy one.    The food was really good too.   My fella and I ordered:  The Eggs Benedict Florentine (Eggs Benedict with no Canadian bacon, with mushrooms and spinach) with a side of potato pancakes instead of regular potatoes or fruit. (Small upcharge.  Totally worth it.) The Waitress Special:  an 8 oz ham steak with 2 eggs (over medium for hubby) and a Belgian waffle.    I didn't try my husband's eggs and ham, as I REALLY dislike ham.  He loved it though.  I did, however, steal a bite of his waffle, and it was absolute perfection.    MY meal was delicious.  I absolutely adore eggs benedict, and I only get to eat it maybe twice a year.  The eggs were poached perfectly.  The hollandaise was creamy and delightful, and everything was seasoned well.    My potato pancakes were delightful.  Served with sour cream and applesauce, they were light and delicate.  A touch underseasoned, but I'd rather they be underseasoned than over.  They were spectacular.    I definitely plan to go back again.  And this time, I won't wait for 8 years.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle that comes with the Waitress Special
Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My potato pancakes!
Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waitress Special with an 8 inch ham steak

jIQc5iN6JPmerRURNmy1og.text: First visit to this location, having only been to the E Flamingo location, and this one was nicer inside.  I had the Dealers choice with the 8oz ham steak and it was delicious. I was leery cause sometimes ham can be dry when ordered out, but this was cooked perfectly.  3 eggs sunny side up and crispy hash browns completed the meal. Coffee was just meh, but drinkable.  Wife had cinnamon swirl pancakes and it was huge. Four large pancakes covered with a sweet icing like the cinnamon buns you get in the can. Wife ate 2 and took 2 home. Service was excellent, always filling the coffee and water glasses. Present without hovering. Will definitely go back

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1xL-ICM4qJP9LZmpDUb8zw.text: My Grilled Cheese was amazing and made to perfection. The cheese was gooey and the bread was toasted amazingly with the right amount of butter. You can definitely feel the home cooked country vibe.  Historical Facts: Blueberry Hill Restaurant has been family owned and operated since 1966.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UNqpVKko6Uyv60F02p7otA.text: Excellent food, at least breakfast is consistent, fresh and fast. We've had several opportunities to try different menu items and consider all the food good.   Today I had the Wild West omelette, served open faced with hash browns and toast.  If it is meat and cheese you crave, this is it, lots of diced ham and cheddar!   My husband got the dealers special, eggs scrambled, choice of meat, he gets the ham steak, hash browns and toast. The ham steak is a generous portion, grilled and smoked.   Because we both love pancakes, we added the cinnamon pancakes! The are so good. The cakes are light and fluffy, sprinkled in cinnamon and drizzled with a powder sugar icing. Just enough sugar to put you in a coma for the rest of the day!  Our server today is Maria, we often have her and she is always on it, brings us refills, often remembering our drink orders even before we sit down! As always, service is great, friendly and fast.   If you want homemade desserts, they also have many pies and cakes to choose from.  I've had a slice of their cakes, one day, I'll order a whole cake, perhaps the orange cake, or maybe the chocolate, or the ... oh, so many to pick from.

J-UYlT83-4XS3bdeLDBYxw.text: This is a beautiful place to enjoy breakfast, their service was impeccable, their food was DELICIOUS- we came in from outta town and were in search of something away from "The Strip" and we were definitely impressed. The waffles, eggs benedict, hashbrowns, bacon coffee were on point! Will definitely be coming back thank you again for your excellent service.

NyrAUCFaQgb8GryyBmE6jA.text: My mom, dad,  and grandma accompanied me here for breakfast this morning and the food was delicious as always!  The pancakes were big and fluffy and the corned beef was great as always.  My mom enjoyed her French toast and my dad and I loved our omelets (which, by the way,  are huge!!).  Our server was very friendly and made sure our drinks were always filled and we had everyrhign we needed.

ZwlFBjNpItcUlH1d3OY_hw.text: Who doesn't love an all day breakfast spot. Was in Vegas for a music festival and crawled out of bed around 2pm and drove here.  My usual go to at Blueberry HIll is the french toast combo. It comes with two slices of delicious french toast, two eggs and hashbrowns. This is all for under $10!   Their pancakes are also great. Love the apple cinnamon compote pancakes or fresh strawberry pancakes.  Service is great.   Definitely come by if you don't want to get ripped off by Strip pricing.

75wj7hZZTrCmpnqMInULjw.text: I am giving this restaurant one star because of the customer service and quality of the food. Our server Donald was full of it. I order the chilaquiles (probably was my first mistake) as soon as I took a bite of the chips they were stale. The only thing that taste good to me was the eggs; I ask the waiter of I could remove the chilaquiles because the chips were too stale for me to eat. He proceeded to lie to me about the chips being freshly cut and pulled out a thermostat to prove to me that he checks the temperature of the chips that were served to me. I was taught the customer is always right; Donald proved to me that he is more concern  with being right then a repeat customer. On a good note my boyfriend loves his food. Only complaint he had was they do not offer alternatives for pork like turkey bacon or sausage.

JY90IUT_kenpL2JaAhbtpA.text: I LOVED the breakfast at Blueberry Hill. I ordered the Strawberry pancakes with a side of the Honey Coconut chicken. The pancakes were SOOO good -- they can definitely feed 2-3 people. The chicken was just ok. All in all, the meal was really good. I would definitely come back again.

BXli094w2uyhHQ-6c2tsfQ.text: So we pull into the former Marie Callendars last night and thought we'd give this place a try as we hadn't had breakfast for dinner in quite some time. Well after sitting in a dirty dusty booth I immediately regretted my decision but my kid said mom come on don't be like that.   Anyhow we ordered cheese stuff French toast with fruit and the Triple 4.    First off their sausage links for charging more then a Denny's or IHOP which I never go to , are disgusting.  There is no meaty quality they are soft , mushy and a slight grayish color.  The bacon thin crispy salty of low quality and he eggs were just whatever.  Well my spikey red haired waitress I called her over to show her my pancake was pure batter in the middle and she takes my whole plate with eggs and all on it back to the kitchen I was absolutely shocked , disgusted and puzzled.  Wtf you see the pancake is messed up ! Wtf why did you take my whole plate with my food to the back then bring it back out had me scrape my food and take the batter pancake back? Made absolutely zero sense   So she has two more pancakes made without even asking me what I wanted to do. The biting of the battery pancake was revolting and left me feeling putrid all night    She then says "O honey I understand I'm not mad at you" are you freakin kidding me ? Mad at me ? For what for being victim for your over priced horrid food.  I have half the mind to call the health department because I guarantee things need to be cleaned up back there   I quickly threw cash on the table and bolted out taking the two freshly made pancakes with us.  We have them to a homeless guy closer towards Decatur.   Seriously Denny or iHop has much better quality food and service.  How about next time your client goes chomping unknowingly on a uncooked pancake leaving a batter disgusting mess in their mouth you don't make them pay for that crap. I'm still upset this morning and I feel sick now.    That French toast thing the cream cheese on the inside was lumpy and tasteless and the whole toast was covered in powdered sugar   Icing I ate it just to get the damn moment of the pancake out of my mouth and I'm regretting it over and over now.   You will get better quality meat and eggs anywhere  se McDonald's Burger King anywhere.  You tourists who want breakfast and don't go here go to a casino where the food is good quality and the servers actually know how to treat customers and amped situations and have customer service not just thirsty for a higher tip.    I had such a moronic waitress I'm really going to give them a mouthful today !   The corporate office said they were going to refund my money but here we are almost two weeks later and nothing. Thanks for the lies

MjLlOBXvCOT-4LtgRBpYTg.text: Ok so it was highly recommended to try this place ...I was not impressed. It seems like a Dennys to me. It pancake was ok. Our meals were ok. The hash skillet had too much potato and not enough meat. Maybe it was an off day for the cooks?  I don't think I will go back.

VTwk8KOnfGYmxTKz4YROXQ.text: Came in last night an as usual we always ordered a lot of food. If you're really hungry then come here cause all the plates where super loaded. My dad eggs and pancakes they were good. I had club sandwich excellent. My mom and aunt had beaded pork chops, they couldn't finish so we took and ate or for breakfast. Waitress was really helpful. Definitely recommended.

SsPRLBa0BCfVc-GnosFtdQ.text: Stopped by on a Monday morning, place wasn't busy at all and I was seated right away. My server was Nix and she was super friendly. I ordered the honey coconut chicken and waffles and some shredded hash browns. The portions were very generous and food came fast and hot.  The waffles were big & fluffy with just the right crunch. Hash browns were cooked good. The chicken is chicken breast vs bone in pieces which I think would work better but it was tasty. The coconut flavor wasn't overpowering which I liked because I'm not a big fan of coconut. They have a big menu, all I looked at were breakfast items. I'll definitely come back to try some other stuff.

Gr--0orj5NLwMD_aGSaUdw.text: I will start by staying this place has the best pancakes I have ever had. They put liquid crack in it. Lol.   However, I CAN NOT stand the evening crew at this location. My honey and I like Blueberry late at night and every time we come in (anytime between 11-2) the male greeter/server who works that shift, ALWAYS tells us the reason they are slow is because of a cook shift change. So it takes 3 hours for a shift change? I don't think so!!! One horrible experience with him was, he had the nerve to write my order down incorrectly, so when I got home and realized I did not have my liquid crack, I had to drive all the way back. He had the nerve to come outside (as I'm re-waiting for my food) and argue with me about what I ordered. Ugh...he is the reason this location receives 2 stars. Just got home with our five different desserts and let me tell you I've never had to chew so hard on a piece of cake/cheesecake. So disappointed.

KC9F5ZIGzkwEZejQhRodkA.text: My fiance and I tried to make a pick up order. The lady who answered the phone was named ASHLEY was EXTREMELY RUDE. She gave us attitude during the entire call, when we asked how long it would be before we could pick up she said "HOW ARE YOU PAYING" we said I'm sorry how long will it be and she yelled "HOW ARE YOU PAYING" we just gave her the credit card number and then she asked for the address, zip code, and a bunch of other strange extra information. Then she said the machine didn't work and asked for it again. We told her never mind and hung up. We order from blueberry hill every week and they have never asked us for any of these things besides the credit card. ASHLEY need to be spoken to as treating your customers horribly will make sure you have no customers. We love them so much especially the Marilyn parkway they are so amazing and kind. I will never call or go to this location again!!

zVBq8nVQuqu5zP2BruInXQ.text: Best pancakes I've ever tasted! My review is primarily based on the pancakes. I've tried two flavors, Oreo and chocolate chip, and both were really good. I've always ordered them to go. But the decor looks really nice. In the take out area or when you first walk in, you will see cakes. I've only tried the Oreo cake, which if you love Oreos or cookies and cream, will satisfy your sweet cravings. I have tried their breakfast there and I would have to say it's an average breakfast of omelettes and breakfast meats. But if you want to try one of the best (if not The Best) pancakes in Las Vegas come and pay this place a visit.

9_bfQ1npo4T0ho8Fu2bLig.text: We stumbled upon this place walking from our hotel. It was around noon in the middle of the week. Our waitress was probably the best I've ever had. So sweet, so informative, so patient (I'm indecisive and the menu is huge) so attentive and so funny. The portions were huge! And the food was fantastic!

FdCuoloUDIAdRQMQB2Ua4A.text: Excellent.  I found this place in a CBS radio list of great 24-hour diners in Las Vegas (24-hour in Vegas is easy. Great 24-hour is not) and it certainly measured up. After perusing the multi-page menu I decided on breakfast. The waitress accepted my substitution with a smile (four sausage instead of two sausage, two bacon) and although it took a while to come it did not disappoint. Well-done eggs, sausage as requested, solid fluffy pancakes with heft and flavor.   Service top notch, food as well. Worth a return trip and seeing as they're open 24 hours, they'll be ready when I come back.

ASaNj1_tPqG1Zr-TEuPzvg.text: We wanted to try something away from the strip and this popped up on a must try. We loved it. The food was delicious and the service was great. I will definitely be coming back on our next trip.

P1keOJpEa32WlGp7f3ZShg.text: The inside of this establishment looks nice but don't be fooled, they couldn't handle a simple breakfast order after 1:30 PM on a Sunday. My boyfriend & I had been looking forward to finally eating here on our last day in Vegas. We ordered the usual pancakes, bacon, eggs & after waiting about 20 minutes our waitress came back to tell us the kitchen lost our ticket & she'd have to retake our order (which she couldn't even remember). And what was her manager going to give us in return...free coffee. How about you take care of our meal that we'll have to wait another 20 minutes for??? Customer service here is beyond subpar, I suggest finding a place that can at least get your order through to the kitchen.

rTMRI7scBA7_4BWwUwnhjg.text: This was our first time eating at Blueberry Hill & I can't say enough wonderful things about it. I had a grilled cheese & bacon w/ curly fries while my husband had pancakes w/ breakfast potatoes. The food was DELICIOUS, but the service was even better. Our server Felicia was so genuinely friendly and she made our day. You generally don't expect to have a trip to a restaurant brighten your day that much, but this was a very nice surprise. We look forward to eating here often & Felicia deserves a  raise.

3KtnQ3CCmlRmYQGT8Uol8A.text: This was the best breakfast that I've had in a restaurant in a long time.  The place is spotless, superb service!  I had the Irish Eggs Benedict, absolutely perfectly cooked!  My husband had the pork chops and eggs, so much food cooked perfectly.  His pancakes were amazingly fluffy!

fa-NTIQVvWCOc8Vde75JAQ.text: The meatloaf and Turkey was awful. The older waitresses argued while our food stood on the counter getting cold.

I4YCl17_znQcbKZgSA5YtA.text: Service is always very good, but last night at 10p it was just bad. Walked in to be seated, waited at the sign and the 3 waitresses working were all behind the counter talking to each other and 1 was even sitting down. After about a minute standing there with them looking at me, one said to the other "go seat them" and just walked off by me. Time to pay and the same 3 at the counter talking to each other and 1 sitting down. 1 at the register but she ignored me and said to another after 30 seconds of me standing there looking at her "he needs to pay". It will be quite awhile before going back

LLXmYGj6aXap4WVvM9TcuQ.text: We ordered room service to the Excalibur Hotel and the food was delivered in a timely fashion. The bacon was a nice size not see-through and nicely crisp, the potatoes were deep-fried which I didn't like as I thought they were going to be like home fries.  The eggs were decently cooked but I said soft scrambled and they had a little brown on them but they were okay now the big problem my blueberry compote syrup had two white hairs in it which got in my mouth and I had to pull them out which is disgusting so I did not eat my pancakes so they need to tell someone to wear a hairnet but for the price it was a good value a good amount of food and other than the potatoes being frozen crap that they fried and the hairs in my compote syrup I would consider a good value. My sister had an omelet and it was two meals, plenty and lots of meat she said it was good, art for $30 I still would not eat pancakes with hairs in them.

5grAURn7liVCZqUlxo6utA.text: Seriously, I don't think they care that the service here is bad- or rather non existent.   When we came in for brunch, we had to wait a few minutes to be seated, which was no big deal. However, after we were seated and received our menus, no one spoke to us for 20 minutes. Nobody asked if we'd like drinks, servers passed us without even acknowledging us.   Right when we got up to leave, someone asked if we'd like drinks, it was too late. We were too pissed and hungry to deal with it.   Then the hostess said sorry and held the door open as we left.

m48Cv4W3UliXcTTZNmMvMw.text: Sitting here waiting for our food.  We've been here since 11:30 it's now 12:50 still have not received it.  Asked the waitress what was going on she gave us the run around saying that they were still waiting for it to come out.  I spoke to the manager Steve he said he apologized for the inconvenience that there had been some sort of confusion in the kitchen but apparently no one could clarify what the confusion was.  Our original waitress was Chelsea and the one came to explain everything was named Felicia she said that Chelsea didn't even want to come out for being so embarrassed. The manager Steve only offered to cut the bill in half which honestly was not good enough for me.  It's one thing to mess up but it's another to let your customers sit there without explanation. I'm sure If we hadn't complained they woulda let us sit there longer.   This was my first and last visit to the restaurant. The food was good when we finally got it but we didn't even get to enjoy it because our experience had already been ruined.

2M5p1hePueD98g9j751dgw.text: The chicken and waffles were amazing! Definitely another visit in my future. The wait staff was great as well. Plenty of options to choose from and they're open 24/7!

l82WQCGyKR6skatwlzkzKw.text: Went here for breakfast and I wasn't disappointed. Our waitress wasn't the best but that was the only minor thing that wasn't good. I ordered the Tennessee steak and eggs with a side order of pancakes. I ordered my steak medium and it came out well done (blah). Even though it wasn't cooked to my liking it wasn't tough and it was still flavorful. The pancakes (OMG!) some of the best if not THE BEST pancakes I've ever had!! They were light and fluffy and HUGE!! The portion sizes are huge and although i was starving i needed a to go box. My friend had the sausage , egg and apple pancakes. There were no complaints from his side of the table. Next time i come to Vegas, I'll be back!

Jr9nBp6AieQEztp4-IsGHQ.text: I generally avoid reviewing chains, but my experience at this Blueberry Hill was bad enough that I felt it would be a disservice to my fellow Yelpers not to leave a review - especially considering there are nearby Blueberry Hill locations that have much better service.  Keep in mind this was at 11:30am on a weekday when the place was half empty:  - waited nearly 10 minutes to be seated despite only one party in front of us and tons of empty tables - waited more than 10 minutes for someone to take our drink order (we were ready to order food, but he told us he couldn't take food orders and would get someone) - waited another 10 minutes before we were able to flag down someone else to take our food order - waited nearly 40 minutes more for our food to arrive  To top it off, our order was messed up in multiple ways (wrong type of toast, eggs cooked wrong, missing hash browns), and when we asked to complain to a manager, we were left waiting long enough that we just decided to pay the bill and leave. The only possible explanation I can have for my experience is that servers and staff here are not trained well and management just doesn't care. It's a real shame, as I generally prefer the food at Blueberry Hill to other chains.

M_To3u5lHRQJWpW80kZCfg.text: Yaaassss for better than IHOP combo meals on Sunday mornings when I'm visiting family Las Vegas. You can't go wrong with any of the breakfast meals, but I'm not too fond of the lunch or dinner meals. Prices are great as well! Please make sure you have the biscuit with butter- it's a meal in itself.

1_cTEwAfN83_HGE5xYnnUw.text: The Black Bear had a 45 minute wait. So good old Yelp took me here!  The place is tastefully decorated. Very clean    The breakfast was fantastic. I base all breakfast joints on their Chicken Fried Steak and theirs was great!! New spot when in Vegas

9RxCDkiqBoEQLidgqdzTQQ.text: This is my family's favorite spot to hit on the way out of Vegas. The food is so good, everything taste like a home cooked meal. Been coming here for 3 years now. Best place to eat near the strip.

rqcNZWh3viaNN18JYEiTAw.text: I was in the restaurant industry for 20 years and this restaurant is as professional front and back as can be. The service and food are great:  Nothing fancy, but well executed consistently.   We come here for breakfast, lunch or brunch everyday when we're in Vegas. We could eat for free at the hotel, but would rather be here instead. Everyone here treats us like family. The food quality is always above average and the place runs like a well-oiled machine.   I told the Manager that he's doing a great job in hiring, training and employee retention. We always see the same staff for years because they truly seem to enjoy to work at this establishment. Their great energy and a positive attitude transfers to our overall experience every time!

u_yHRhYw_QG979vs1ZjuMw.text: Had the biscuits and gravy with eggs and bacon. They gave a very generous portion and the biscuit and eggs were delicious. The bacon was really greasy, though, so I didn't finish that.

bfQuA7uA-EeD9dZ_hic43w.text: Items Selected: Bottomless Coffee Warm Blueberry Muffin Honey Coconut Chicken and Waffles - Honey Coconut Hand Battered Chicken Breast, Butter Cream Waffle drizzled with Honey, Honey butter Chocolate Chip Pancakes - Chocolate Chip Studded Chocolate Buttermilk Pancakes with Whipped Cream Carrot Cake Blueberry Crumb Cake  Newly opened in a renovated Marie Callender's on West Flamingo near Yonaka, it was in forgoing one last stop at The Griddle Cafe that I entered the newest location of family owned local favorite Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant, and with service as friendly and efficient as ever it was a five-part order that constituted breakfast as well as later-day snacks - some items absolutely delicious, while others decidedly lacked.  Located on a busy corner, with a parking lot nearly filled to capacity by 9:00am though the enormous restaurant was only perhaps 2/3 full, it was with the first of several cups of 100% Arabica coffee that the meal began and with bold flavor and a smooth finish one must say this is an area where Blueberry Hill excels, a statement no less justified in describing the 'limited' run of Blueberry Muffins, baked fresh each day and served warm with a streusel top and sidecar of butter, quick to sell out and "gone when they're gone."  Having sampled the Monte Cristo and Oreo Pancakes on a prior visit to the Decatur location it was once again in two entrees that appetite was invested and with a rich buttermilk recipe handed down since 1966 the supple texture of a 3-stack of pancakes was only improved by smooth whipped cream and a handful of melting chocolate chips, a chocolate fudge drizzle requested in place of the included syrup making things all the more decadent at absolutely no additional charge.  Moving next to something somewhat savory, suffice it to say that Blueberry Hill's Chicken and Waffles is nothing like that which one will find down South, yet having watched a young line-cook hand batter each strip in the kitchen, roll it in coconuts, and then toss it in a fryer the attention to detail was appreciated as each piping hot piece paired nicely to a pliable golden waffle well suited to soak up a drizzle of honey and plenty of butter soaked in the same.  At this point happily sated, but with a long wait at the car dealership ahead, it was with two slices of cake made in the on-site bakery that I took my leave and although the carrot cake was dry, spongy, and almost entirely devoid of flavor aside from sweetness from the cream cheese icing the Blueberry Crumb cake was a masterful composition with moist yellow cake, buttery crumbles, and bursting blueberries beneath bright blue frosting that tasted surprisingly natural, and not overly sweet.  A bit more expensive than chains such as IHOP, but obviously committed to using better ingredients and taking extra steps to assure customer satisfaction, Blueberry Hill remains one of Las Vegas' best 24/7 locally owned stops - the sort of place I'd probably never eat dinner, but one where breakfast is never a bad choice.

qdBh_w0zglF3gQ_mSdSmIQ.text: One of the challenges when you come with your family is finding an affordable place for breakfast. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy all the Strip Buffet's and fine dinning but sometimes your just not in the mood for all the "extra" aka waiting, driving, etc.. so having a place like Blueberry Hill off the strip and near our hotel (walking distance) was ideal.   Its a traditional breakfast restaurant with a lot of options (can be good or can be bad) but you know it will carry the staples from Pancakes, French Toast, Waffles, Omelettes, sandwiches, soups,.... you get the point. Excellent food and breakfast was consistent with what we expected. Our selections of food varied from the Waffle w/coconut Chicken, Chocolate chip pancakes (lots of chocolate chips), spaghetti, and Tender Pork Loins with a few sides. Again, we were all over the place but everyone was happy.   When ordering, ask questions and don't expect it to be the same thing you got back in you home town at the local breakfast spot. For example, it comes with sausage... is it a link or a patty, is it port or beef... is it fried or panko covered, what's in the salad, can i get it on the side... you get the point.   Over server was cool and kept the refills of water and soda's coming. They have a great selection of desserts to choose from when your getting ready to leave (mainly cakes). Given our proximity to our hotel off of Flamingo, we would definitely come back as they have plenty of options for the pickiest of person's.

Vrme2eWoe5Fl_RdGue5A2w.text: This is one of our fave spots for breakfast with my ohana. Love the atmosphere and menu selection.  Today was a particularly slower day in the morning which was nice, no wait and quick ordering. The menu is pretty vast, breakfast, lunch, dinner, desserts.... whew! About 8 or 9 pages to it. All kinds of breakfast selections pancakes, waffles, omelettes the list goes on.  As you walk in you are greeted with a waiting area in the lobby and a specials board (mimosas & bloody marys were on that board today) as well as a grand display of cakes and pies See my photos to see what was in todays case! Mmmmm. Carrot cake!!!!  The dining room has lots of seatings for small or large groups as well as an old school diner style seating at the counter. As we were sat the dining room wasnt too crowded which is a good sign, fast food! Instead of looking at the menu we opted for the specials today. Real simple! 2 Mini waffles w/eggs and sausage ($8.99) for my little and a spinach and cheese omelette add bacon (+$1.69) (total $9.99) Everything came out quick along with my coffee and OJand my little was satisfied with her chocolate milk ($3.09 and no refills) dang!!! Thats okay she was pleased especially with that whipped cream for her waffles   The service is always good when we come no complaints. Today was slower then normal so expect a waittime on the weekends.   Love Blueberry Hill!!!!!

tcImqdO65RYM78yqYIvZqA.text: We just moved to the area and needed to grab some breakfast before stocking our new apartment with groceries. Good coffee, attentive and friendly staff, large portions, and delicious food. Prices aren't that cheap but hey, we don't go out for breakfast every day! My husband got the chicken and waffles and they were superb, they looked so good I just had to steal a bite. I got the vegetable fajitas with all the fixins including guacamole and beans and rice and roasted jalapenos. If we ever are wanting to treat ourselves for breakfast again, this will be our first choice :)

zLWTKCyiBkr0HoNnpS4bow.text: Attended a baby shower in their private room in the back yesterday afternoon. Absolutely lovely time.  The hostess of the party was allowed to place decorations she had brought. The restaurant set up a large table for the hostess to use for a dessert table.  Blueberry Hill has its own bakery, but management was gracious enough to allow her to bring a "special baby girl" cake.  The party hostess and management selected a list of 12 entrees for the guests to choose from for dinner. (The restaurant's regular menu is HUGE with wide range of prices; often difficult to make decisions on a selection.)  This allowed for preferences but was time-saving.  The serving staff were prompt, polite, kept our drinks filled and, when done eating, tables cleared.  The guest of honor, the party hostess and others were very happy with the event.  We will use their private room again for other meetings and parties, after this pleasant experience.  Sincerely,  Haze K.

iCWBnOIT8QPEzNpozUBqZg.text: This is an amazing place for breakfast! Heard great things about it so decided to try out. It's huge inside, was packed on a Saturday morning. We got seated immediately. Service is very efficient, got water and coffee right away and it was refilled very quickly.  Now the yummm part. Have to admit, the BEST WAFFLES AND PANCAKES. Waffle is crisped to perfection and their home made butter on top... mmmmmm.. pancakes are so fluffy and flavorful. They make it look real fun for kids, my kids pancake pic attached :) When was the last time you had a great side of toast at a breakfast place? I can't praise their toast enough lol, perfect temperature, so buttery and crisp! My kids even raved about how good the bacon and sausage was.  Highly recommend, this is going to be our new fav bfast place. They serve lunch and dinner too.

HmC6mL4DA5u3b9UE0Tw0CQ.text: This morning I ordered take-out. A very easy order to make (Belgium waffle with fruit and a side of hash browns) Didnt think it would be that difficult. The man on the phone quotes me 15 mins for the food to be ready. I was there & back to my work within 12 mins. When I picked up my order, they reassured me that everything I ordered was complete. I get to work, open the bag... first of all there was NO hash browns, second I go to eat my waffle. It was completely Soggy and a little warm. OBVIOUSLY, it was NOT made fresh. I work in the service industry. I would never send soggy, not freshly made food with my customer. Completely unprofessional, I will never again order food from Blueberry Hill.

DbnAaWHYwfjozk7AisvRgA.text: Bring your appetite because they serve huge portions. So you get what you pay for.  The place is clean and spacious.   Service is always great! And the menu is extensive.   I can't speak for any other items on the menu, aside for the breakfast options; which are pretty basic in my opinion.... so you can't really mess up lol.   Today I ordered the Tennessee fried steak and eggs, with a side of chunky potatoes extra crispy (of course)!!! Steak was 6.5/10 for me, it wasn't very fried; but I didn't really mind. The parts that were fried ended up being super soggy. So I stay stick to the 10oz sirloin.   The omelettes are huge too! And always come out 8-9/10. Can't go wrong.  I frequent this place when I'm in Vegas because my boyfriend's family loves this place. No complaints here.

gvoiSdIyJM_-qqwRr1iqPg.text: Came in to Vegas early in the morning and found this restaurant.  It appears pretty popular and if you are a pancake lover you will love this place. My daughters ordered the cinnamon pancakes and the Oreo pancakes. Both portions were so large and rich that neither girl could get more than halfway through it.  My eggs and biscuits and gravy were very good and rich.

Zk55Cv4IE5pdC2YMpfJUDg.text: Warning! You need to make space in your belly! My fiance and I know better than to indulge in late night meals, but when we do, we do it at Blueberry Hill. Particularly the Flamingo and Decatur location. Not all of the staff is great, but we can name a few that definitely make the experience way better! The bussers work their tails off, Martin you are awesome! And Norma, Chelsea, and Marvi, you are the few waitresses that place cannot do without! The food is good, but the people can really make or break the business. We love their homemade soups, chicken noodle and the meatball soup are the best! Their chicken parmesan is a classic, but I enjoy the crispy chicken without the sauce, the sauce can be a bit bland to those who eat without salt, but im sure if you add a dash it might be better. Regardless, I always enjoy the dish. Their honey coconut chicken is a must! And so are their pancakes!!! And their french toast too! You must try them with a side of ice cream! Yum!!! The only downside to eating here is the "itis" at the end...the "food coma," if you must...but definitely worth it.

zoyGt_kldPlNcxGEddgmXQ.text: I drive past this restaurant on my way to work every single day and finally decided to try it out!   I arrive at around 10:30 and surprisingly beat the morning brunch crowd, which was a big plus! Our server, Jessica had some really appetizing recommendations. One of which, I had to indulge in. The Very Berry French toast was the BEST French toast I've ever tasted in my life.   The eggs Benedict came out looking super tasteful! The diced potatoes were so delicious, I wish I ordered some to-go!   The kids menu is so full of many choices, I was surprised my daughter took a VERY long time to decide. Her pancakes came out looking so appealing to her, she chowed it down so fast.   I absolutely love the fact that this is a FAMILY restaurant, only because I have 2 young children inherited my raging hangry attitude. The crayons was a perfect touch to distract them while our food came out. It was also cool how they tag-teamed to deliver our food to the table, rather than multiple trips.   Jessica recommended so many items, I'll be back to knock them off the list! She is definitely one of the cooler servers I've ever had in a dining experience, which will definitely bring me back again!  Can't wait to try more!

yb0blXhBhFgeYo6CE5GXGQ.text: The food was great and our server was bubbly and enjoyable. The woman who seated us, however, was very flat and seated us at a dirty table. It had been bused but the seats had crumbs in them and the table had syrup and water dripped all over it. She saw us talking about the dirty table and came back by and asked what was wrong. We showed her the drips and she said "oh, that's just water". We had to show her that it was sticky and she said "ok I'll wipe it down". Granted, she did come back and wipe the table down, but I still ate my breakfast with someone else's crumbs in my seat. Call me old fashioned, but if a customer points out the table being dirty, it shouldn't matter if it's water or not. In the service industry, you should just clean it up with no argument and not try to excuse the table being dirty.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2Y8yqqJjWB5Gw8V5DJtnfw.text: I came for my first time to have breakfast with the fam. I can say the food was really good for the money.however I ordered an Texas Chilie omlette. Flavor was great but the beans should have cooked another hour or two. They were very crunchy but good flavor. The other bad note was they do not offer senior discount on the weekend my one last complaint is we waited over 1 hour and 10 min for our food. We told the manager and he had the too bad soo sad attitude. I also noticed on the menu omelette comes with gadh browns and they still charged me $2.95 extra. So other than hard beans and crappy service the food was very good.

lcmw40hCcN71LDSuP3Vy6A.text: This is a nice location decorated in a more modern style. We stopped by at around one in the morning on a Monday night and the staff was extremely friendly. Unfortunately, they were out of or unable to make mashed potatoes, pasta, or soup that evening so the meal options were much more limited than I would have liked. We stuck with eggs and toast and it was pretty good. The scrambled eggs were a bit rubbery but the toast, bacon, and hash browns were all really good. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant during normal business hours just maybe not so late on a weeknight.

CWtJITqMBtxOxKGChP1mFg.text: Open 24 hours!  Just like a NY diner.  Sadly this menu does not have 'disco fries' on their menu. However, try them by ordering fries with melted mozzarella and brown gravy;)  My favorite server here in the AM is MARIA!

IFmpku4dFe06EkoF6-A1dA.text: 11am meant 45 minutes of wait time on the Flamingo and Decatur location so my group headed to another location by Decatur and Charleston. We arrived with a lady in the parking lot trying to sell me and my friend jewelry to buy laundry softener, super random and declined politely. I admired the three plate specials displayed by the front along with the rotation cake fridge. I ordered a chilequile which meant I cleared my plate. I had chicken fajitas and my husband had a chicken club. Both tasted great and were more than we could eat. Other than the bathroom looking pretty yucky and being out of tp, it was a great experience.

UhSfpbY2h17p9CC-FdIIQQ.text: Came in with my family, a party of 7.  This is my first time here.   The food was great, I had the Pancake Sandwich.  The kids had the Kids Chocolate Chip Pancakes... which had to be a mistake as there were 3 huge pancakes with chocolate chips for $2... Folks and sister had the Chicken Parm...it had a nice presentation...but tasted flat.  It needed a lot of salt and parmesan cheese.  Brother in law had the Sausage Skillet.  The portions are generous.  The coffee is outstanding  The service is somewhat unconventional and there appears to be a lack of "must be adhered to standards" that you get at corporate restaurants... Service wasn't great...but it certainly did not suck.  With a little work by someone who knows the business, this easily could be a 4 or 5 star family diner.

0zjV2-vlnHLBjbUU5VrDyg.text: I think this has now become a place for my SO and I to snag breakfast in Vegas.  We initially found it because we walked over when staying at the Palms, and it's not a far drive from the strip.  They have a big selection here.  I keep coming back to the various chicken and waffles options that they have.  If you're in Vegas and don't want to wait for breakfast on the strip, definitely check this place out.

7fYj3JO2QsHe_pKuCr0HEQ.text: If you come here you won't be disappointed. There is something on the menu for everyone, whether you want breakfast, lunch or dinner. It is a great brunch place! I had the Tito bandito and it was a plentiful amount of food and was tasty. All servings are large and you will not go away hungry. Service was average. Would definitely come back and continue to try items off the large menu!

oX_UW-qvQxOn1njtwtJ1Yw.text: Pretty good food. Nice waiter. Was expecting a little better place. But no real complaints.   Kentucky fried steak was ok. Monte cristo sandwich was a large portion and good.   I have no reason to put this place on my return list. So this time it's a check mark. Tried it and let's move on.

VDFTGWsZ_tSMO_XTQ-6K5w.text: So,  the first time we dined at this Blueberry Hill our experience was OK. It was a Sunday afternoon. We were seated quickly,  service was OK, the restaurant was clean, food came out in a decent amount of time.  My daughter was happy with her chocolate chip pancakes,  boyfriend was satisfied with his steak and eggs, my "little boy blue" was meh. Portions were large,  prices are reasonably cheap,  flavor/seasoning was meh (my blueberry pancakes, while tasty on their own,  were smothered with an ample amount of blueberry goo... firm, almost hard, blueberries in a heavily corn starched "sauce").  The second time....  Again,  it was a Sunday. The lobby was full so we were expecting a half hour to 45 minute wait,  so imagine or surprise when the host informed us it was only going to be 10-15 minutes.  Score! We were seated in the allotted time,  however it took about 15 additional minutes for our server to greet us and another half hour for our order to reach the table.    My daughter's medium steak came out very well done (dry with no pink). My over medium eggs came out sunny side up (I'm pregnant and "shouldn't" have eaten them but was starving at that point). Boyfriend's medium burger and over easy egg also came out disappointingly over done. Our friend's biscuits and gravy came out burnt? But as mentioned earlier,  we were super hungry/over it and didn't want to wait another hour for a refire... our server was nowhere to be found.    To be fair,  we'll probably give this place another shot in a few months.   Until then,  we'll stick to our go-to weekend brunch spots with consistently awesome food,  consistently long wait times and consistent service (Mr. Mama's, Babystacks, and Eggworks).

6gUCiNlDignn4aOdxTRDtw.text: Great oversized portions of home style food. Yes it cost more than a McNasty but it is real food and the taste will be worth it. Staff is always friendly and effective. I'm here for the food not the entertainment :)

A8go_EwwoG6KP6pSd2ZBXg.text: Arrived at 8:30pm, was seated and right off the bat our waitress, Halle, immediately began complaining about her day. After ordering, she proceeds to complain about the food they serve saying it's "gross" as well as making very unacceptable commentary on the customers at other tables. One comment she made was "they're so f***ing needy." Soon after, she drops off our food to the table and immediately asks "could you guys check out early so I can leave?" Unbelievable. Never have I ever been rushed to eat and pay at a restaurant because the waitress didn't want to stay. I ordered nachos, which were meant to come with various toppings and it was only cheese, and the chips were burnt black. After letting her know she became irritated and scratched it off the check and says "there, took it off. Eat it if you want I guess." didn't even OFFER to make a new plate. This was my only entree. She talked over me and I had to wait to flag her down to have a new one made, she was busy chatting. She handed our table off to another waitress (who was very kind) and she was out the door. I guess the managers are gone after 6pm according to young lady up front, but I have a card and will be contacting manager tomorrow. This was the most unprofessional, appalling behavior I have ever encountered from a waitress. Very disappointing considering I've been a loyal and repeated customer for years. It's been a couple hours now and my roommates, as well as myself, are still very bothered by our experience tonight.

3_OUHDY0qeN9ycxY2_hB2w.text: What a surprise. A friend recommended the restaurant for dinner when we commented that we didn't want to deal with a casino for dinner. The food was excellent. We had the coconut chicken and waffles and the chicken Parmesan with spaghetti. The chicken had very light breading and was super flavorful. The chicken Parmesan was a healthy portion and delicious. Desserts here are s treat, the Oreo cheesecake was amazing. Ask for Gwen, she's delightful, tells a good story and provides great service.

-POiz_DW4-stqe5LLLX6Lw.text: Went to brunch here with my son and bestie! Food was amazing a fare in price for such great tasting food. It's like getting a fresh at home cooked meal without having to make it!!

4y02sdeF4fgM_3nvdLK_Cg.text: Patty melt was amazing with great service. The restaurant was clean. Kind of hard to find out here.

h2u7Y0UOf8F18gdfn9c52w.text: Great food. Excellent service. If you're ever there after hours, ask for Don, a great bartender.

l0phY8SZvR8B_NHXgq0ufA.text: Horrible service. The hostess looked up at us then went right back to doing whatever she was doing. She did not say hi or anything like "We'll be right with you" just continued working on whatever it was she was occupied with. We stood there until finally a younger girl sat us. Still, nothing was said but "follow her" --  The waitress Barbara walked up to the table and said with an attitude "Are you ready?" We started to order; the entire time she was very unpleasant not looking at us once, and throwing her hands up in the air when I asked what salad dressings were available.  At that point I could no longer handle the negative service and as she started to repeat the order in a rude tone, I let her know we no longer wanted to eat here because she is rude.  She then stated "I'm just repeating your order" again, throwing her hands up.   Ended up at the location on the east side of town. Much better service. m1L0_zsJtXBhPw-IAJ8bUg.text: First time at this location.  Enjoyed the laid back diner atmosphere.  Quick service and tasty food.  We had salads and soup....but the BBQ rib special looked pretty darn good  One suggestion would be to include some No Sugar Added desserts along with the selection of cakes and pies.

e6fPK0cbhBI-G1eMChRPYA.text: Would rate 0 if I could! Went there this morning for breakfast with family! Our waitress Tammy was very rude and had an attitude like she was mad at the world! My wife's eggs, potatoes and bacon tasted like they were cooked in old oil that was used to cook skunk before! The manager did take her breakfast off our bill! As we left(without leaving a tip) we saw Tammy pointing at us and talking to another waitress! Maybe Tammy didn't like the fact that I was carrying my gun, which is perfectly legal! Never had such a problem in other Blueberry Hill locations! We won't be back!

Qz-0XU1hHbO8mZXQ9NrwFQ.text: Nice clean and big restaurant. Extensive menu...lots of breakfast items to choose from. The hubby said the coffee was good. The others in my party had pancakes...short stacks. They were really light and fluffy. There were three pancakes about the size of a salad plate. So here's the thing...I ordered a ham and cheese omelette. They make them with four eggs. I asked if I might be able to order one half the size. The server said sure, it could be made with two eggs. Cool!  She asked if I wanted bread and potatoes. I said no carbs for me. I happened to look at the menu after she left and saw three pancakes could have been one of the sides I declined. One of the others in my party could have had that. Oh well. But the real surprises when I got the bill. My two egg omelette was $13.99...full price, just as one made with TWICE the ingredients. AND there was a full charge at menu price for those who had short stacks. They didn't take one off since it came with my breakfast. Come on, guys, just because we were in Vegas, it doesn't mean we had money to throw away. The food was good, I was just a bit put out that the server didn't suggest one of the short stacks to go with my $13.99 omelette nor did she mention that a half omelette is full price.
