kqmXMjH4MPH4n6tDIJjJZg.text: Always love coming here for breakfast, the pancakes are HUGE.  Expect to have some appetite come in here.  The price for 4 people was about $15-20 per person with drinks.  Food is solid, and staff is good.  This location use to be a Marie Calendars so it is quite new in appearance and spacious compare to the other Blurberry locations.  Great place to take the family and kids.  Pros :  Good place for breakfast. Pies are yummy. Staff is friendly This location was bigger than other Blueberrys Kids menu items were huge  Cons :  Coffee could be stronger.   Steak should have more seasoning for steak and eggs breakfast.  If still give this classic Las Vegas breakfast spot 5 stars.

c8F6R0aKOjicokWpejDdlQ.text: I love this place.  The food is like home cooking.  Chicken and waffles for breakfast, and the dinners (my favorites are meatloaf and liver and onions) come with soup or salad, and if you're a senior you also get your beverage and dessert included.  Great deal.  And, the servers are terrific.  I've never had a bad experience in the many times I've eaten here.  My only suggestion to management, can you add some fish to the menu?

ESI2QSxIpETeWyEcpMErKQ.text: We have recently been going to the Blueberry Hill on Decader and Flamingo. The food is good but the service is excellent. The servers really care about their customers and treat them with warmth and friendship. This location is a quality restaurant. When we come there for a meal we know we will receive excellent  service  with a warm smile. This is what makes the difference for us. Thank you

PZFgbsuMqg2nhEBWC4dvEA.text: Blueberry hill is a super cozy restaurant located on Flamingo down the street from the palms. I've been here a couple times, my boy friend loves this place. It's great for brunch, reminds me of a Marie Calendars with the desert display in the front. I always get the chicken and waffles which are delicious. The Oreo cheesecake was really good too. Last time I was there I ordered a mimosa which was more juice than champagne, I was a little upset about that. Other then that I've never had any complaints, the service is always fast and they are friendly. I'm going to to try the pancakes next time which I heard were bomb!

vLspewldvsjQy6p84VjWrw.text: WHOA. Where have I been? Like what planet have I been living on? Lol. Okay, so maybe my taste buds are feeling some type of way right now because I've seen the reviews and not many people have enjoyed this place BUT I feel it's one of those gems that are a little underrated. Maybe it's just me?  I too was a little skeptical. I wanted mashed potatoes or just an All American type of meal. My BF had tried it many years ago (lol, palm to forehead!) okay babe, Let's give it a go.   Exterior looks a little dated and interior looks like the outside...dated but in a weird way, I dig it! It was clean and well kept.  So I saw our waitress take pancakes to another table and I told my BF that we needed to order pancakes because they were HUGGGE and Fluffy!!! Dripping with that yummy strawberry compote and whipped cream. Let me tell you, they were worth every bite!   Our server was sweet and welcoming. She was knowledgeable on the menu items and also letting us know about portion sizes as well. I ordered the chicken noodle to start. Very hearty! Full of chunky veggies, chicken and noodles. I also ordered the Honey Coconut Chicken which came with mashed potatoes and steamed veggies (broccoli and carrots, yum, my favorite!) My Bf ordered the special which was meat loaf topped with red sauce, fettuccine and a garlic bread. He said it was very good and really liked the fettuccine, it was simple and tasted homie. And to share, we got the Fresh Strawberry Pancakes topped w/ strawberries, whipped cream and strawberry compote.  Everything we had was splendid! Definitely give them a try at this location.

q_DlhIofR5crNUSp0ezFqw.text: Not my cup of tea..  Today a friend and I came here for breakfast.  We waited about 15 minutes to be sat and were greeted right away with water and coffee from the "busser" I believe.  A server then came over after a slight delay and we weren't quite ready so she said she would be back in a moment.. that was probably a 20 minutes later moment.  We even flagged down someone else who worked there and asked for our server.  We finally ordered which included a beverage..   We then received our food, still no drink, and there were breakfast potatoes instead of hashbrowns.  Rather than just apologizing and getting me what I ordered she showed me she had written down breakfast potatoes.. I work in F&B.. I don't really care what you write down.  I continued to wait for my drink until after the hashbrowns I ordered came out.  It was as if my drink was the dessert at the end.    We then had to flag down our server again to pay as we had been there for nearly 1.5 hours at this point.    I tried this place since I haven't been but I would recommend sticking to Babystacks or Egg Works for what you would expect at breakfast!

oLELc2Y6Q0GlgVPtewfwmg.text: You can't go wrong with Blueberry hill! One of the best places to eat in Las Vegas. It is a staple! The food here is always consistent and hot! I come around 1 when it's a little bit slower but this place I always full. For great reasons! I believe the best bang for your buck are the skillets. It's an entire skillet with potatoes meat and cheese served in a pan. I opt for the Guadalajara skillet with chorizo and potato and I get the skillet added with mushrooms! This meal is a 10! Ofcourse you can't go wrong with the Chocolate Oreo pancakes. I always buy pies here for events! They have the best pie in Las Vegas I choose the coconut creme pie and chocolate silk pie and they're the first pies gone at gatherings! I have also tried the monte Christo sandwich with French toast! I love the taste but my only thing is the French toast becomes a little soggy ! I'm sure you will find something for everyone here!

S0im4ZgXUZFiquVK2BVJsg.text: We've been coming to this Blueberry Hill since we moved to Las Vegas. The food is excellent quality and the portions are far from stingy. All of the staff are very friendly. This is easily the best part of coming to this restaurant. The waitstaff ensures that your desires are met, and they do it with a smile. I need to personally shout out to Sara and Chantel! While I don't know them personally, they always remember us and greet us as if we're friends, as do several of the others. We always feel welcome here. The menu is versatile, and served at all hours. Pricing is also inexpensive. This restaurant is well worth a visit.

j6NYr6skQiX43O4b0pG0Gg.text: Las Vegas' Blueberry Hill Restaurants have been around since the 80s and we finally got around to having a taste. Conveniently open 24/7 the restaurants are a great fit for every mood and occasion; all-day breakfast, lunch, late night specials (aka drunk food), and all-American comfort food.    Some of the other locations are old and run down, but this "new-ish" location is well kept and modern while keeping its warm diner-esque feel. Late night specials for $5.99 are offered from 11pm-7am, daily specials are affordable at $7.99 a plate.   We were two of four customers early this morning, waitress Nix took care of all of us. Great customer service! Very attentive and friendly. She seemed to get along really well with the other patrons. That small-town restaurant banter is hard to find in this city.   We look forward to dining here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast date

Et2PN5JiR8u8Em6z27ClTQ.text: Every time we are in Vegas this is our go to breakfast, lunch and even sometimes dinner. Parking is ample. Service is attentive. I think they renovated. I love that they make their dessert there. Never had one. But they do have a very pleasing display at the lobby. Foods is usually pretty good. Huge menu!

HbE57cqAAjAs3AajEsaIKg.text: We had a breakfast here and enjoyed it very much.  Between the two of us we has eggs,  bacon, sausage, and pancakes.  Everything was excellent, the portions large, and the service outstanding.  We will go back.

Csa5zjDlOgRG585FfYsbsA.text: Thank you! Perfect brunch spot for locals and tourists!  This was a perfect redemption meal from the awful service and food at Sinatra at Encore (10x the cost) the night before.  For the two of us, we had under a 10 minute wait on Saturday at 11:30am.  Comfortable seating. Great layout. Very friendly, but clean and unique layout of the restaraunt. Immediately knew that if the found was even half-decent, we would become regulars here.  Sure enough the service was on-point. Wait staff was on their game. The food (Pro-tip: honey coconut chicken waffle) was a winner. Great food, easy in & out. Well priced. The dinner menu looks great too, and I wouldn't mind trying it out sometime if in the area. Didn't get to try out the desserts this time but that looks worthwile too.  Thank you! We will be back and we will be bringing (lots) of family and friends with us!

_UDN_Qo9WuZriEOdc8AKRg.text: I have to say I was very pleased with there food. Me and my buddy ordered a burger and wow the meat is delicious and huge ! I would come back if I'm ever in town again. I give it a 2 thumbs up. Have a variety or choices of food to choose from.

1yU9IEjr5jvjOk44kTbHuQ.text: Great place. Enjoyed the Meat Lovers Skillet. The Cinnamon pancakes are awesome.  If you come here, please ask to be seated in Nix section. She is awesome. She is very knowledgeable, fun, spirited, and very professional.  Thank you, Nix for a great breakfast.

PAwrUnfzmI5nDWaiNYZyKA.text: My favorite breakfast place and my comfort zone. I always drop by right here to get food before I work. Not a fan of their pancakes but other menu and pastries are absolutely amazing. I love how servers are very friendly and accomodating. Definitely suggest it to my friends. Hoping to keep up their friendly long time business :)

FPpddb3Sta3rKaowuKzXwQ.text: I had my food delivered and wow it was fantastic! It was hot and delicious! Will definitely order from them again!

BUzMYXlNUQngxODUv7aXiQ.text: Norma royalty screwed up!!!!  I love BlueBerry Hill. I've brought my mom, family and Fiance here a couple times. And we have family visiting next month and plan to bring them here. ...BUT...NOW we might not come.   June 14, 2017 approximately 8:30pm. We came for a late dinner. I called ahead of time to see if there was a wait. I was told no. When we got there we had the wait like 5 minutes for them to clear off tables. ...restaurant wasn't even a 1/4 full. And many tables were already set up. Then the Hostess seats us all by ours ourselves in another section of the restaurant.  Tell us our waitress will be right with us....nope....after like 10-12 minutes we had to send my son to ask for our waitress. ..then she came over.. didn't greet or even apologize for I ur wait.. just asked if we know what we want.  We order a Monte Cristo Sandwich and I Double Chesse burger. She asked if I wanted the one with Chili. I said Definitely not. Just the cheese burger. She said okay left.     After a few she brought over our food. My son order was right expect for no extra sauce on the side as requested.  And she handed me a Chili Chesse Burger.  I said oh no, I didn't order that.  I said I can't have Chili, I have intense heartburn. That would be a bad thing for me to have. She said oh, I thought you order it. She didn't apologize nor say she would handle it, instead she said can we just scrape off the Chili? She said I have a group of 18 over there.   What?!?!?!!!!  I was offended that she ask to scrape off the chili off my burger and give me the same sandwich back. She didn't offer to make me a new one. I told her it's already late and if she not able to just get me a new one soon. Go ahead, I couldn't have the Chili.  She ended up taking it back to the kitchen then brought it back to me.   As habit I took the top patty off to ear and noticed there was still chili on the burger. They just swapped the bottom for the top patty. I wasn't happy at all but it was coming on the 9:30 now she came back and ask if we were okay. We pointed out the problem and I said I don't feel like I should have to pay for a this kind this. She said no, I'm going to waive the charge for it. She said she just wants to make it right. I said it will be fine. I WAS through the roof, upset at this point.   I started eating one of the patties, then a few minutes later she brings me a new burger. I said okay, I didn't ask her to do that. I Ended up eat like half and boxed the rest up due to me losing my appetite.    After she brought me the second hamburger,  we were completely ignored by all staff members.  Until the Hostess came over to bring me the ticket.  So obviously wasn't ask if everything was okay, do we want dessert,  is there anything else like drink refills ..   When we went up to pay the tickets was showing full price. I told to the hostess that our server said she would to comp the burger due to a mix up. She asked the waitress she said no, she ended up getting the right one. I said excuse me, you said you would take care of her. She mumbled something and the Hostess changed my total.   I was completely disturbed how the situation was taken care of and the to do it.  I am going to reach out to management in the morning.   Thanks for reading,   Victoria Martinez  Executive Housekeeper

2Leh1eB6ufiXWSHsZ2TAuQ.text: We never had the chance to eat here because we walked in 5 waitresses at the front messing with the cash register and 1 counter her food tickets... NO ONE bothered to look up or say hello... I had to ask if we sit ourselves and got a look from the workers as if I was bothering them. We walked out and went to Black Bear Diner where we were greeted with a smile and seated immediately. This is not a very Christian way of doing business nor professional.

pw626tqQT2sUCRN1dEtF6Q.text: I am so glad that I didn't take the recommendation of other reviews and not come or come and expect mediocre. The pancakes are delicious, fluffy, hot and already sweet! I had the Bonanza with ham and scrambled eggs! This is my new place when I come to visit!

w-NCgyjOfgUDmW_e2bHCRg.text: My family and I ate there for breakfast there food was okay I mean my kids half of it that's the only reason why I gave them 2 stars but there service sucks they keep forgetting my sister and my little niece drinks I think it was because of there  religion because I got my food in time and I'm not cover up like my sister is so with that said I'm ashamed for our waitress I will never go to this restaurant again

GC6byqG9npoLeRsHB1zBow.text: Service was fantastic but the food was mediocre. The place is immaculate.  Great atmosphere and super clean. The server was great. Super sweet and took great care of us. But the food...  The food wasn't very good. I got the roasted turkey dinner because who doesn't love a thanksgiving turkey dinner?! Well, I was disappointed unfortunately. The turkey was dry, the stuffing was bland, the the mashed potatoes were cold and the corn was very salty. I really wanted it to be all that I wanted and more but that wasn't the case. My fiance got the country fried steak which was okay but nothing spectacular. Guess we should've stuck with ordering breakfast food. Apparently their French toast is delicious.   I probably wouldn't go back. I give it 3 stars because the place is very nice and service was great.

MZPkbNoR_d6zcXYTw73JCg.text: My friend and I came here for breakfast and it was fantastic. I had the strawberry crepes and they were pretty good. My friend had the country fried steak and eggs Southern style and said the biscuits were ok, the gravy and the steak we good, but the hash browns were a little undercooked. Our waitress Shannon was very attentive and nice. Overall, looking forward to coming again

4DG8n5Vh3hiBvnkS5lUt5w.text: Huge portions!  The prices are a bit high, IMO, but considering the quality of the food and the amount of food, the prices are not too unreasonable.  I went with my mom and my two year old.  The 3 of us shared a Spinach and Mushroom Omelette and we didn't even finish all of our breakfast.  Omelettes are made with 4 eggs and come with your choice of side (3 homemade buttermilk pancakes, 2 wedges of french toast, or hashbrowns and toast).  We opted for the 3 buttermilk pancakes.  They were delicious,  thick, fluffy, and great flavor.  I was impressed that they were served with real butter and it was whipped.  Nice!  Also, the syrup comes to the table warm in a syrup dispenser (no cold syrup from a single serve pack).    The omelette was good, nothing too special, but good.  We told our waitress we were sharing and she was very accommodating and brought us extra plates.  We asked for more butter and she brought us a large portions of that glorious whipped real butter.  Went again with the husband and baby and I ordered the Ham and Cheese Omelette with pancakes.  Omelette was cheesy and tasty.  Pancakes were still delicious.  Again, asked for more butter and got a huge dollop of real butter (the pancakes probably come with plenty of butter but I like A LOT of butter, especially when it is real and whipped).    My husband ordered the Blueberry's Meat Lover's Skillet.  He loved it (and he is not afraid to let me know when he thinks something is not so bueno).  He said it had tons of meat, but not too much, and the pieces of meat were large and great quality.  He had plenty to bring home and had it the next day from breakfast and still did not finish it!  Both times our servers were extremely friendly, courteous, and attentive.  The ambience is nice and they had sports on the tv's through out the restaurant.  It reminds me a bit of a Mimi's Cafe or Marie Calendar's, as far as style, but a small step up and much better food.    Menu is huge with tons of variety.  There is something for everyone, anytime of day.  Oh, and the cakes in the front look amazing.

hwHoLD2Qk6wkxbwjDACyTw.text: Hello.  Thank you for letting me write an review for this restraunt. Here is how I judge my reviews off of each restaruant I visit. Now the pricing is not a star because the sandwiches are at least 9.00 to 12.00 which doesn't include tax and as for this is why I  give it a .5 star. Now for the speed, it all depends on how much people are currently in the restaruant. I am currently in the restaruant and have gotten my meal within 15 mins of waiting. So for that I rate a full star for the speed. The Quality of the food is amazing, not burnt and ready to eat. So overall this restaurant 4.5 review, but since the site woulsnt let me do a half star, ill jsut bump this to a 5 star review!Thanks for having me!

k8ltytRsbA-Gc6UFbCuORw.text: This was my first time trying Blueberry Hill and I was excited because everyone talks about it so much. The food was decent and so were the prices but the service was terrible. Our drinks never got refilled, and by the time we were finished eating it took us 25 minutes to get the check.

FRuj_iGTDEGxhKZl2BPxHA.text: This is the best. Josh is a great waiter my wife and I eat here 3 times a week. The management is great we moved and we still go eat their alot. I wish they had one in Silverado ranch.

58E3lDt6InuEDeCjcqcBmw.text: There are so many things I like about this restaurant that I wanted to let them know the few problems I have so they get them fixed and I'll have a perfect restaurant to go to!  Blueberry Hill on Flamingo is in an old Marie Calendar's so the booths are big and comfortable.  Their menu is huge and has a dish to suit any craving.  They have a full bar which is a lot of fun too.  So, now the bad stuff. First and foremost, I DON'T WANT TO EAT TEFLON. Their skillets are served in the scratched up teflon egg pans that are no longer useful for quick-flipping eggs.  When teflon is scratched it chips and gradually comes off the pan.  Teflon is toxic.  It would quit easily get into your food.  The fact that they are using these for table service is UNBELIEVABLE.  Either strip all of the teflon off or throw them in the trash.  Those pans are not meant for table service.  They look cheap and the chipped teflon freaks me out.  The other problem I have is the over abundance of offensive noise.  The music is often too loud and the playlists are alternately depressing or irritating.  The volume on the television sets are often turned up as well so you are forced to listen to a mix of commercials on the TV and bad music from the PA.  I like that the staff is high-energy and has a lot of hustle but sometimes they make quite a racket slamming down silverware and shouting across the room.  The patrons are forced to raise their voices above all of this to hear each other with the overall effect being a constant assault on the senses. I hope this has been constructive because I really do want to keep going there.

ByZYDazSx8DNiK1fFCS3WQ.text: So delicious. I got regular pancakes and they were so fluffy and tasty. One of the best pancakes. Bacon was nice and crispy which is a plus  definitely recommend this restaurant.

7GoYTzh12xCU_bKHwSrg4Q.text: Just out and about and needed a nearby breakfast and this was it. The menu they have is massive. Like it's really too big its way past the point of diversity and just takes way too much time to go through just to see all your options (I like small and simple). Anyway we ordered the pancakes all around (buttermilk, fresh apple, and smiley face) while we waited I took the kids to the bathroom to wash their hands and the men's bathroom smelled terrible and was pretty unclean I cringed thinking my toes might touch the floor in my flip flops. Came back and food was there quickly but the portions were MASSIVE which is usually nice but I wouldve rather paid less and gotten half since pancakes don't really reheat the best. Gf sent back her pancakes because they were too tough and the server was very nice and insistent that we did so and took it off our bill hastily which was really nice. My fresh apple pancakes were pretty good but I'm a big guy and I could only finish half of them.  Overall this place seems to be really popular but it's just not my piece of cake. Really think they should have smaller portions and not just serve and charge for your breakfast and reheated lunch. Probably won't come back since I feel iHop is better.  3 stars because of the bathrooms and the all the food besides mine wasn't really that good.

PYoLIuLD7YasStOa2BnYWg.text: Good ambience, nice to get off the strip for a breakfast. Clean and decent service. Food I had (Irish eggs Benedict )was hot and good.

RhQZoCsy8O2gqnIllw938Q.text: I take my mom here ecery time we get our hair done next door. Extremely good service and even better food.

E8eHYV2SU2wd5HyGnjOqGQ.text: Eh. Denny's down the street is way better. The menu is wayyyy too long. I got the corned beef hash omelet. Eggs aren't salted at all, the insides aren't that good tasting to be honest. It could've had more flavor. Small portion of alright hash browns. My roommate hated his burrito. BW5Q60BmoOgV_I5xyP_vuQ.text: I took my mom to this location since I have eaten here yet and our little group was hungry. Upon arrival I was in awe, this was great. Still reminds me a lot of the MC that was there before they took over, but still clean. Very Clean. We were seated in a booth that was comfy and was told our waiter would arrive shortly. Shortly must have ment 15 minutes because the busser with the coffee came by several times before we our water showed up.  Now our waiter, Josh, was a young kid. But boy did his face read disdain when he arrived at our table. We ordered right away. My mother ordered a piece of blueberry pie, I ordered the Bonanza, and my 5 year old ordered the kids mac'n'cheese with fries.   Then we played the waiting game. Which actually didn't take long at all. My mom received her pie right away. Somewhat to our disappointment because we figured all our found would arrive together. Then came the other meals. I really wish we had taken pictures of the food. My "scrambled eggs" were a little on the runny side. and two pieces of bacon were somewhat burnt. (my daughter actually ate those) Her mac'n'cheese though had burnt noodles, or cheese or whatever it was. She took one bite and almost threw up on the table. Now she's a picky kid so I tried it.... She wasn't lying. It was thick and not creamy and tasted of the burnt whatever. So what does she do? Go to town on the fries.I really don't blame her for not eating it.  So here comes Josh, oh Josh, he asks how everything is and my daughter immediately replies "It's gross!" to which I then in turn tell him it was, when he reached for the plate I asked him to leave it because she was eating the fries.  Fast Forward Check time. JOSH DIDN'T REMOVE THE MAC'N'CHEESE FROM OUR BILL! My kid didn't even touch it and you are going to charge me for it?!?! You even went to go take the plate! Honestly, I was so angry, we paid and left. We will not be returning, and I will not suggest. The only reason I'm giving it stars, is because the other two meals were delicious.

myG4g8elGl0N-N8otDZ_Sg.text: Food is always great quality and a wide variety menu. I've never had to wait long for my meal. Today I had chicken fajitas for under ten dollars and a large portion size. The waitress was attentive and provided great service. Love this place.

Ka5jJbQBR2X1tWP30EBYGw.text: I must admit I was a little scared to try this place based on the reviews but we had the best experience. Our server was Felicia and she was awesome! UYwjnisVyCppKcHt0JcxOg.text: Overall just okay. I have been here dozens of times because I live close. This location is on the corner of Flamingo and Decatur not to mistake for the other location on Decatur across from Wal-Mart. The menu is just silly, way to big and full of food I know they dont sell everyday. Why sell food items you hardly get orders for. They should refine the menu and throw out 75% and just fix the items that are okay. Everything is so bland, they do not flavor the vegetables at all and other things really lack flavor. Only things okay are breakfast items, waffles are good, biscuit and gravy okay. I never really get everything I want though because they are not very flexible, if you wanna make adjustments it might cost $3 when they shouldn't. Service is funny, most servers are just okay and no one works together. They should help each other, refill drinks, ask if everything's okay because your server might not come around. I have literally never got an egg order right though, they always under cook eggs even if told how the yoke is preferred so don't be picky. They hand write receipts and use a hand calculator so confusing what you paid. The menu is confusing, a lady expected hash browns at the other table but was basically told sorry learn to read, no attempt to make them happy. My over medium well eggs came out over read easy again, they didn't even try. Had to ask for refills twice. It's crazy how much this place could improve. The owners hopefully will take note and make adjustments but things have not changed at all since opening. I'll be back for late night wake waffles and will update with any changes. Enjoy

IVPlBGrUS-dd0tVVeWmBSg.text: I love this place, come here every time I'm in Vegas. As a friend of my previously prefaced, I am a pancake lover. Pancakes aside, the rest of the sweets are fantastic. I've tried the chocolate malt shake--so indulgent! The rest of the cakes look divine, so I'll definitely dig into a slice of chocolate of carrot cake on my next visit to Sin City.  Servers are on-too of their game, efficient, funny, and quick. Keep an eye out for Sally, she's the best.  Lastly, the prices. For under $12, you'll eat like royalty, I guarantee.

dXp-QKDh2_IaTHr-LKVQDg.text: There is NO WAY these could be the best blueberry pancakes anyone has ever had.  Worst blueberry pancakes I've ever had - hands down.   The Blueberries are not fresh- they are frozen and tasteless, even the cup of blueberries they gave me on the side (which were thawed, cold and nasty) - the chefs should pop one in their mouth and see what they're serving people. People must be fooled by the blueberry compote they pile on of these pancakes. I opt out of the canned blueberry filling on top of blueberry pancakes so the "real" flavors can come through. This was very disappointing. Blueberry pancakes should never be made with old, unthawed blueberries.  The eggs and bacon were great though and so was the omelette my husband had, so I'm sure other breakfast items might be delish- will try something different if I come back again which I probably won't because there are sooo many other places to eat in Las Vegas. But I will recommend it to others as someplace to try for yourself.   Prices are great for the amount of food you get and the customer service was lovely.

-PpfvoUJIgpfKshdD285kA.text: Nothing comforts like comfort FOOD: I was so surprised by this restaurant.  We used to have a place that seemed similar called Millie's later cleverly renamed "Mills" in my neighborhood and they couldn't even fry an egg...But here, 24 hr breakfast favorites in an array of choices like blueberry or cinnamon and the list goes on.  One of my go-tos is country fried steak and this one was so juicy and tender, no gristle like some other CFS dishes.  You can change up the sides to curly fries as yours truly did.  I wished they would have done green beans with bacon and onion like other country restaurants do, this one was red peppers which dominated the green bean taste.  I want to go back for one of the variations of chicken and waffles like coconut chicken or original.  I'm a sucker for chicken and even more so for a waffle.  Honey chicken strips were alright and both come with either cornbread, biscuit, or both, why not both I say.    You can upgrade to soup/salad and a dessert choice. They have quite a few choices of dessert: strawberry shortcake, chocolate oreo, various pies: blueberry, apple etc.  Cheesecakes like strawberry or oreo.  I have to say, I can't remember a BETTER blueberry pie.  I went home after this and started researching pie crusts and blueberry pie filling - NO LIE!  And as for the soup, it was freshly made and on the brothier side like when you have a flu...I prefer thicker and creamier chicken noodles but this was still good and I got my daily dose of veggies.    Service/Ambiance: actually super spatious, tall pillars and lots of windows and various seating areas.  Feels like an 'Fancy' Denny's with more space.  Our server was super professional and super friendly, she told us her name was Xena/Zena like the warrior princess.  Sorry about the spelling but I'd definitely ask for her again.  She offered drinks to go and made sure every aspect of our dining experience was "On Point" as they say.  So much so that we would definitely go back !!

KFvDcgQzZglY42A6wq_ghw.text: Cake here to have breakfast with my niece before leaving Vegas (her suggestion). Average food and service. First impression was the hostess with a hardcore frown. She eventually warmed up but it wasn't very inviting. Our waitress kept forgetting items and when reminded, her response was either a curt "I know," or "yeah I got it." If that were the case it would have been nice if she said something to the effect of "I'll be right back with your orange juice," as opposed to dropping off most of our items and walking away. Never saw that orange juice halfway into my meal. Instead, she went on to take another order from a table next to us. She passed me three more times then I canceled it. It's ok to be busy and forget. It happens. However, when I politely remind you, I can do without the attitude. It's a weird environment. A lot of the waitresses were frowning. I personally like friendly service so I wouldn't return or recommend it. Oh- good food also helps. My omelette was just ok but none of the kids enjoyed their waffles and refused to eat them. Oh well.

ei4gU-YGeIrlkdbl17HqDg.text: My experience today sucked. After we got seated we waited for 1/2 hour & nobody showed up to take our order, then were taking orders & serving people all around us, so I finally told my husband we are leaving, so we left. I will never go back to that place.

RHA2HKdfNxwDgPkj1dpfdQ.text: i just received my order.  one order was completely wrong, scrambled eggs insread of over easy.  no butter for pancakes, no cream or sugar for coffee.  they are less than 1/2 a mile from where i live, yet they couldn't or wouldn't make this right.   i called grub hub and they told me i would have to place another order to get a driver to bring the items.  thats a $10 minimum, plus a $3 delivery charge to get cream and sugar and a replacement meal.  while they did credit these items (taking over 20 minutes on the phone with with grub hub) i still have a meal that no one here will eat and coffee thats being poured down the sink. me, members of my church and friends go here often because its close to the house.  collectively, we spend at least $350 a month, but never again.  the big bear restaurant at trop and jones has reopened, and we will "vote" with our pocketbooks and wallets.  blueberry hill will never see our faces again.  thanks for the credit.  i still have hungry people here.  who's gonna fix that?

AwAkbeuCK7hatihreIrZDQ.text: The food here is good. Sadly with the kind of service they have here it drags down the food with it and makes it not worth it. It's hard to get refills and twice having asked for a salad it does not come until our food arrives. Like I said the food is good but the service desperately needs some work.

-YLKGVg5T0tMRH1ODY8NEQ.text: Food is delicious! Portions are big. Everything about this place is amazing. It really looks and taste like everything is freshly made.

I3EfGdedcLomg7GyGx6k_Q.text: I just moved here to Vegas from Chicago where these type of places are all over the city. Its taken me about 8 months to finally find a pancake house that has decent pancakes. We came on a Sunday at noon and probably the worst time you can go to a family restaurant. We waited about 20 min. We got our table and served drinks within 3 mins. The menu is hugh! Don't really know if I would eat anything but breakfast here but we ordered the country breakfast and the pancakes were great. They were hot, large, and great taste. We just got regular ones too. I can only imagine how the speciality ones taste. The eggs, bacon, and rest of the food was great. The service was good for being a packed house with others waiting outside. We came at their busiest time and I can say that it's been the best so far in this town of excesses. Without going on the strip and paying through the nose on atmostphere instead of quality, this is the best. Great Job Blueberry Hill. We will be back often.

ES1KBC01fgTAsi8xbWv50g.text: This is THE place to have breakfast in Las Vegas! Right down the road from the Palms Hotel. We're sorry we didn't find this place on our first day, we would have been here every morning for breakfast. The portions are huge! My husband is a big guy with a big appetite, and he could not finish his meal. We both had the ham and cheese omelette with a side of pancakes. The ham tasted like fresh baked ham, not restaurant supply ham. We took the extra pancakes back to our room and noshed on them the following day, they were still just as tasty as the first day and even tasted good cold! Our waitress was on the ball, I wish I got her name because I would give her a special shout out for being so great.  When she packed up our leftovers, She even offered to put my husbands beverage in a to-go cup~! I'm going to look and see if this restaurant chain is in New Jersey~ I cant wait until our next trip to Vegas to eat here again.

0iORWmY7p9k98ZuRK0sx-A.text: We went here for a friends birthday, per her request.  It was my first time here.  We walked in, and were seated quickly.  Our server was fun, and pleasant.  Got everything right.  The food was pretty good.  It hit the spot.  I had soup and chili, and it was pretty good.  Birthday girl had pancakes, and the other one got ham, and eggs.   The restaurant was clean, service was good.  It seemed popular as almost ever seat was filled.  I'm sure we'll be returning.  It's definitely worth a try if you're looking for a breakfast with a large menu, and good service.

RMI7jXa7fYjcJPco0fL4Cg.text: This is the newest Blueberry Hill. It opened up a little over a week ago on the corner of Flamingo and Decatur and replaced what used to be a Marie Callender's.   They didn't change much as far as interior decor goes, but I am glad after quote a while of this location being vacant that there is a new restaurant in the area. Even better to have a new breakfast spot.   On this occasion, my mom and I stuck to the dinner menu and they have several grand opening specials going on now. We opted for dinner entrees and received a free dessert. The menu is huge and after a long time of perusing I decided on the honey coconut chicken with a side of fries and green beans. I do not like canned veggies, so I avoided the green beans, but enjoyed the rest of my meal. The chicken was moist and not overly sweet like I was expecting. My mom enjoyed her pork chops and for dessert I ordered the carrot cake and my mom went with the blueberry pie. She enjoyed her, but I felt mine was a little dry for my taste. I took it home and my fella enjoyed it quite a bit, so it's more of a acquired taste.  I'm usually a fan of this chain's breakfasts, so I'll be back for that. They also have an enormous assortment of desserts to choose from that are all made in house.   The food is nothing amazing, but it's solid and this location is a lot nicer than others in town.

Anb8452oCaatNfP9Ee3tBA.text: I recommend anything with bacon!  I had the waffles and eggs, the waitress breakfast, and the waffle was crisp, eggs were done perfectly and we all left satisfied. The service was nice but the time it takes to get food may put some people off but we were fine

8GRAYwNQOR7Ob44PrMGVLg.text: I've been going to the Blueberry Hill on Charleston and Decatur for more than a decade, so I was very happy when this Flamingo location opened because it's much closer to my house. I've been to this location 3 times, and I always order either the Classic Eggs Benedict or the Alaskan Waffle. Both are absolutely delicious and this new location carry out same great flavors.   The reason I gave this location 2-star is due to their customer service. All three times I've been here, I've had to wait at least couple minutes for someone to greet me when I walk in the door. During my most recent visit, I was with a party of 5 and we got seated at a booth with no menus, no servers in sight, and no busser to serve us water. We waited about 15 minutes to get our iced waters. And then waited approximately another 5-10 minutes for a server to come and take our order. I understand that it was a busy day (Saturday morning), perhaps the hostess shouldn't have sat us until the server was ready to serve another table?   I probably won't be coming back to this location, I am willing to drive to the location on Charleston and Decatur for a better dining experience.

hIZ5mnSgip5qDZFWxwzCUQ.text: Love this place, reminds me of norms in California. Just don't order scrambled eggs, they taste like fish.

_oq4Ihed12Q2tOtbtX2pnQ.text: Well first and foremost the cinnamon pancakes have to be the best pancakes in town!! Syrup isn't needed that's how delicious these were  First my experience here was pretty good we were seated by a host in less than 5 mins (lunchtime) very friendly staff  Server arrived fairly quick and was friendly greeted with smiles...served us beverages we ordered apple juice (which was cold some places neglect serving cold apple juice for whatever reason) but the water tasted like tap some people like myself are fairly anal about that but I couldn't bare drinking it   Next server took our order which was a basic four , four , four breakfast with eggs , bacons and pancakes and also I ordered the speciality cinnamon pancakes   After that the speed in which we received our food was legendary, however as most know that's not always a good thing could mean cold food or just bad quality HOWEVER that was not the case the pancakes were extremely delicious, bacon was average as well as eggs but i stand firm these our the best pancakes in town by far...  One thing I did not like at all was we were served our checked with our food basically.. it made me feel like I was rushed this was a family trip so we weren't at the bar we were at the table.. I suggest future reference that they present the check when they are 100% for certain the customer is satisfied. It can give off a bad vibe if you present the check with the dinner.  Pros -------- Pancakes , servers attitudes, preparation time,   Cons  ----------- Water , delivered check with the food,

obvVEevLxoHW0onWpFvIyg.text: Go out of business . Always consistently Cold food, all the time, every visit, Only item hot was the Coffee & Soup.  very nice employees, big employee turnover, always completely empty....doesn't hire male waiters at all. only polite and inexperienced waitresses. Attempted again today cold eggs, cold burger, cold everything.   Over-worked waitresses leaves food to sit forever before bringing it to table this has happened on 5 different visits. L2KgURpok7J3-5XPdm0o9A.text: Loved this place. Everything is home made and created to order. I had an incredible omelette.  The server said the pancakes were the best so we ordered that too.  Bomb. Will definitely be coming back.

gIgRF_MkfRwlkRCVl2kljA.text: OK this place is where the Marie Callenders used to be, it was vacant for a while then Blueberry Hill came in. I enjoy thier other Decatur location by 95 and the first time I came to this one the service and food wasn't up to par.   I ordered thier Giant Baked Ham Sandwich and it was huge! The menu says a quarter pound but I honestly think there's more in this one. Comes with lettuce, tomato, mayo and your choice of bread. You can also have curly fries or regular fries with it.   This sandwich was definitly satisfying, more than enough and very reasonable at $9.99, thier menu is huge! So much to choose from, definitly no shortage of options. I'm not much for breakfast so I'll eat lunch food in the morning if I'm out, and there is a ton of options if you don't want to just be limited to lunch food.   The service was on point, never had to ask for a refill, very friendly and kept checking up on us. This experience was a lot better than last time, I always give places another chance. Sometimes it could just be a shitty day, this one not the case on this visit.

tPwNtOvklknTlPdWQoyJtA.text: This is our favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. We tried it on a whim last time we visited and have only ever been impressed. Aside from having an extensive menu, we feel very much at home and this particular location treats us incredibly well.  Ambiance is exactly what you'd expect from a "hometown" type diner. The staff is friendly and casual, the furniture and fixtures aren't the newest, nor are they the nicest, but they give off a warm atmosphere and it is very easy to feel comfortable here.  The service is always friendly and attentive. I couldn't ask for more from a five star restaurant, let alone a little family style diner. We always get smiles from our servers and our food is prepared quickly and correctly. Interacting with the staff here is always great.  The food is the highlight, undoubtedly. Blueberry Hill has an incredible menu and we've gotten a different item every single time we've been. It would take a long time to work your way through the entire offering. My personal recommendation is the four cheese French toast. Out of this world.  Blueberry Hill is a great place to get filled up for cheap and enjoy delicious food and gracious service. This is a "comfort food" place first and foremost. Nothing fancy, no glitz or glamour, just warmth and heartiness.

Wt-GEurUx-LV7Zrizq4UxQ.text: This Blueberry Hill location is a great high volume breakfast based restaurant that has done well in my visits...  BH Ambiance & Service:  Tons of seating to anticipate lots of diners and it's very busy during my breakfast and lunch visits. There's also a counter and full sized bar.  Servers have consistently been good and it seems like everyone here knows how to handle big tables.  The kitchen gets your dishes out fast even when the restaurant is at full capacity  BH Cuisine:  I'm a fan of their breakfast plates and I order them during non-breakfast times.  Recently I had the Mexican skillet and it was tasty dish paired well with two fried eggs on top.  You can't go wrong with any of the omelettes and the pancakes are always generous in serving and fluffy.   Their monte cristo is delicious and loaded with meats and cheese. When I'm not eating a breakfast plate, their cheeseburger is what I'm ordering as it's done well for me here.    I don't order anything too complex at high volume restos.  Overall, I stick to the simple dishes and Blueberry Hill has delivered every visit.  They're open 24/7 and if I'm on this side of town I'll visit here before any Strip coffee shop.  Enjoy! =)

x_WLk7hlsqyrRB_ql8qljw.text: Monday September 3rd 2019 -Labor Day 10am  Barbara was our waitress she didn't seem happy. Hoping we caught her on an off day. I gave her eye contact and asked for my eggs over hard. She wrote down over easy and then tried convincing me what I ordered.... So I munched in buttered toast while I waited. This place is super loud. Not just table laughter/ chatter but the dishes are slammed often.  The syrup dispenser was gross- it had yellow egg yolk on it. I read the reviews expecting large portions and it was average sized portions to me. I ate just my eggs and corned beef in my skillet and left the potatoes. Waitress didn't ask how the food was or anything. She did take our plates. Worst first and LAST impression I'll have of this place. Cashier felt bad about our experience but I rather pay the bill than get a manager I'm sure he/she hears enough complaints. I got all dressed up wanting to make it a special holiday morning.  Maybe we caught them on an off day but I thought the food was okay - truck stop food. Coffee was jet fuel and no flavored creamers to lighten the heavy taste. Left here in a bad mood when breakfast is supposed to make you happy.  We paid our bill and decided never again. Such a shame too - gorgeous restaurant and bar!! Crap service.  Guess I'll stick to what I know as good breakfast I feel so sick from the amount of soybean oil in the food it warns you on the menu. That should of been a red flag for me.

JJ0G8rAJUcczni0y8mYH2w.text: Came here late around 10pm, restaurant was quite slow. They also have their late night menu, not a lot of regular food is on the late night menu.  I just got the cheese burger and fries, and another Alaskan waffle. Friends got the monte Cristo sandwich and an omelet .  The burger was just ok, I guess I can't expect too much if I am coming to a breakfast place looking for fantastic burgers. We also asked the waitress to put out the Alaska waffle last, because we wanted to have it as a dessert since it has ice cream on top of the waffle. When she put out the waffle the ice cream was completely melted like it has been sitting out for a while rather than recently prepared like we have asked. The Alaskan waffle dish itself was great though, waffle made perfectly, it would of just been much better with not ALL melted ice cream   I sampled my friend's monte cristo sandwich, it was delicious savory meat on a sweet French toast bread, definitely something different you could try.

KsAw22kI37zhY-SbkPZJQw.text: The ambiance of the restaurant makes you feel at home. When you walk in there is a giant case of mouth watering cakes and pies to drool over while you wait for your table. We were seated fairly quickly.   Once seated, I was overwhelmed by the amount of options on the menu.  I couldn't decide on breakfast or a sandwich so I settled on a Monte Cristo. It was very good.   The reason why I am giving the restaurant 3 starts is because the service was not that great. We asked for additional silverware and the waitress just stumped it all on the table in front of me and when I asked for some extra napkins, I was given 1. Literally, one. Someone at my table ordered pancakes and it took us about 15 minutes to finally get syrup and no one ever came to check on us about the quality of the food. Thus, it took a decent amount of time to get a to-go-box and our check.  I would definitely still check this place out. Maybe I just went on an off day.

XSGLkRb4mH0MTbUPEYsFOA.text: Great home cooking, if your from Kentucky!  The menu is lengthy and there is something for everyone, heck there are even potato pancakes!! The must try Blueberry Muffins will cause you to order another because they way the muffin visits the grill before it reaches your table.... well just will blow your minds. I always get the Blueberrys Meat lovers skillet and it has not let me down yet!!

bQ6iBPlufnpscomwq2MaQw.text: This place was recommended to me based on good food and good prices.  It did not disappoint!  I walked in and was greeted by a very friendly hostess.  Since I was alone, I asked if the bar was open seating.  With a smile, she said yes, so I found an open seat at the bar.  The server handling the bar area seemed very busy.  She was working hard, but perhaps it was a little much for her, or maybe she wasn't having a good day.  She still greeted me with a smile and gave me a glass of water.  A gentleman who arrived after I did was served first.  That didn't sit too well with me, but I understand that in a busy atmosphere, mistakes can be made.  She then proceed to ask me if "I was ok with just water."  Strike 2.  I normally enjoy iced tea with my meals, so I ordered one.  She was constantly moving and didn't seem to rest, so I knew she was working hard and doing her best.  I ordered the Tennessee Fried Steak and eggs which, according to the menu, seemed to be a specialty.  The server was very friendly while taking my order, so my forgiveness for the service began to start.  My food arrived promptly, and I was very pleased to find the hash browns were still hot, and my steak was still steaming.  Fresh, hot food is always a plus.  The steak was delicious, tender, and cooked perfectly.  The hash browns were delicious too.  The sourdough toast were thick slices, and although they were a little burnt, they still tasted like sourdough toast should.  As the crowd let up a bit, my service improved.  She not only asked if she could refill my iced tea, but she also asked if she could prepare one for me to go.  She was very friendly at this point, and she wore her hard working smile well.    Overall, I was pleased that I ate here.  The recommendation given to me was accurate.  Delicious comfort food at reasonable prices!  If I decide to return, I plan on trying the pancakes or chicken and waffles plates.  Both looked like they would be delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tennessee Fried Steak and eggs

U3Dj-Zoy4emwcWWEMf9TbA.text: Having long been a fan of Cracker Barrel and looking for something similar and slightly more convenient, we happened across Blueberry Hill.  Being a fan of anything blueberry I liked the name immediately.  Inside there is a large dining room and friendly staff.  They have a very extensive menu of dishes ranging from breakfast to meat loaf and American classics to southwestern cuisine and beyond.  I decided to go for the honey coconut chicken.  I opted for the upgrade ($4 I think... ) which gets you a soft drink, soup/salad, and dessert as well.  The chicken looked a little different than the picture, but it was crispy, juicy, and had a perfect coconut taste without being overpowering.  I opted for the green beans and mashed potato for sides.  The green beans were decent though a bit overpowered by all the red bell peppers that were present as well.  The potatoes were smooth and definitely had a homemade taste rather than a boxed, dehydrated potato flavor.  The salad was fresh, crisp, cold, and had a good variety of dressing choices.  Save room for dessert... They have so many!  Of course being at Blueberry Hill and loving all things blueberry I went for the blueberry pie.  Truly out of this world!  Outstanding juicy blueberry filling with an excellent crust with sort of a streusel topping.  Truly one of the best pies I have ever had.    Blueberry Hill definitely exceeded expectations and will definitely not break the bank while providing a delicious selection of mainly "comfort food" and outstanding desserts!

RMzBEOO1RfeNTY8E42i_0A.text: I had been to this building several times when it was a Marie Callender's restaurant.  After being empty for a while, Blueberry Hill did some remodeling and opened in this spot.  I haven't been to a Blueberry Hill for over a year now.    I had spent the night at the Rio Hotel and given their food choices, I opted to come here for breakfast on the way home.  I ordered the Texas chili omelette which is described on the menu as onions and American cheese with homemade Texas chili on top.  It's an open face omelette with lots of beans but a bit less chili than previous times I've had this.  The recipe has changed.  You have your choice of a side and I got hash browns.  I ordered rye toast.  There was a bus person who came around often and refilled coffee mugs as needed/desired.  It was good to see him coming toward my table.  I rarely am out of the neighborhood when I have breakfast.  This was a good choice.

WDeUSqpZ6OtHA6Qks-800g.text: This was our second time here. Our first time was a better experience. The table we sat at had been set up for two people, when we had four in our party. Our waitress did not come to our table to ask us for drinks for at least 5 minutes after we were taken to our table. When she did arrive to take our order, she wasn't friendly and her demeanor seemed like we were taking too long to state our order. She seemed to rush us asking "are you ready?" to each of us.   We had to ask for two more set of utensils when our food arrived. My hash browns looked like the cook just tossed the leftovers from the griddle onto the plate. There were pieces of hash browns all over the plate. Our waitress never returned back to the table to check on us if everything was ok. The staff was not attentive. My mother in law was looking around to find anybody to flag down to refill her soda. At this point it was 2pm, and most of the crowd had left, so it wasn't too busy. We may not go back to this location.

K-WFpOAclR9DiWyWlv0lzQ.text: Been here a few times & both times they were great. The restaurant is beautiful, the service is quick & decent, the food is scrumptious and the prices are fair.  You will enjoy this experience and appreciate the delicious food!

xsMjEjWCr0WcyKvFRVHecA.text: Hands down the best french toast I have ever eaten in a restaurant. I've been here twice in two days! ordered the ham steak and 4 French toast slices...hash browns...no powdered sugar...WOW! great service...both days! im here till friday and i will eat here every day!!

cKIiK_U6nbvyLrISiA7L1g.text: We left the Orleans hotel to grab breakfast here. Just about a 5 minute drive from the hotel. Plenty of parking on a Monday morning. We walked in and seated immediately at a large booth. Restaurant was very large inside. I was fooled frim the outside. The decor is nice. It looks like they may have recently remodeled. TVs hanging everywhere as well.   This spot was like denny's on steroids. The popular dishes are the waffles with chicken tenders in top. I went with the chicken apple compote waffle. For $11, it was definitely a lot of food. The apple compote is house made. Not too sweet. Chicken was okay with it. I felt it could have used a bit more seasoning. The waffle was good. It did get a little soggy but it was expected with the compote. I ordered one biscuit and gravy a la carte, $4. I thought it was good. They take a large biscuit and slightly toast it and slather it with their gravy.   Kids were happy with their pancakes. No complaints there. Plenty of food and drinks to go around at the table. Coffee was regularly served.   They did take a long time to bring us the check. I had to get up and ask for it. We paid  $63 for 3 adults and 2 kids. Not a bad deal. I would eat here again. Stop by the dessert counter and check out all those confectionary works of art.
