jDpP0wXSosR5jM_TpCxFmA.text: I went here once on vacation and loved the decor, but hated the service.  Super slow don't check on you but food was good.

Jyj7HpFWaG0OnavHhmOjag.text: My family and I have been coming here for many many years. Every time we come, we request Maria to serve us. She's amazing and keeps us coming back!! The cooks make great food and cater to our personal requests and diet restrictions. Thanks guys :)

Ky7ydHLCDxfGzuf8xnVHDw.text: Our waitress Nix was so much fun! She knew the menu so well! She made the meal a 5 star experience!

iKzt0xbOfjvKRnLc1avHqw.text: HORRIBLE service. There was hardly anyone in the restaurant. We waited an hour for our pancakes and waffles which never did come out. We finally got up and left. No apologies from ANYONE!  The waitress that waited on us (or shall I say never waited on us) forgot drinks, silverware and of course our food. When I went in search of her (after 45 minutes) I found her flirting with the cooks. She saw me and flat ignored me. When we were leaving, she saw us, got another server to act as management and then hid in the back. This was not the first time something like this has happened at this restaurant. Steer clear of this one. If you want Blueberry Hill, go to the one on Decatur. This one has not only bad service, but their food is not even mediocre compared to the one on Decatur.

5oCtV3-vPTi7jyJiYJNLaQ.text: The food was alright, eggs not cooked all the way but biscuits and gravy was great., however the service was terrible with late food and drinks halfway through the meal, wrong drinks. I would never come to this place again thanks to the service.

dHB_0aq9WLPtmxHWmT97Sg.text: I really want to give 4 stars for the big portions and yummy food but I came in drunk at 3 am and really wanted to enjoy my meal in peace without talking to anyone since I came in alone. Luckily, I was feeling like a happy drunk that night, but my server was testing my patience. As I waited for my food he talked to me and made it clear that he thinks I'm attractive but said nothing rude or offensive but clearly I'm like half his age. Then the food comes out and I'm ready to grub. He leaves for a second, comes back then says "I'm your server so you don't have to be embarrassed of stuffing your face in front of me." Then he goes off about Adam and Eve and his theory behind it. First off, I came to the place to eat, not to be social especially when I'm exhausted. Second, religion is the last thing I want to talk about. Third, I like taking my time to enjoy my meal rather than stuffing my face so I can get you to leave me alone and stop talking. I have never once had a server talk to me during my whole meal. I think I just felt too hungry to give a shit about telling him off. I literally kept nodding my head the whole time as I'm stuffing huge bites in my mouth. Oh and after he tells me his theory, I have one bite left and he says "You can tell me if I'm talking too much." And starts laughing like it's funny. I'm not sure if that's just the way he serves people by making conversation or if he was just trying that hard to get my attention. I was just bored and uninterested I'm sorry to say. I swear I'm not a mean person but damn, that was annoying.

27wPSYNSbMdz7Oma8nab-Q.text: I went for dessert and a milk shake,food was 100% however the reason  for 1 star was the server(#8)he was just plain STUPID he repeated my order twice and got it wrong,finally after going over each word he got it.Not very complicated pie & ice cream and a malted milk shake,he was very RUDE I asked for the check and I asked him to take it to the cashier and he refused,he said I had to do it myself,although I have other servers do it for me (handicapped) he finally snatched the credit card(roughly) out of my hand and returned with it and threw it on the table.(what tip LOL)and for this reason 1 star and never to return.I have been there many times and had a perfect time,great servers and food a little high priced but quality and quantity is more than justified.

YxP4-hcYOJpD1UQs67iWZQ.text: I've been coming to Blueberry Hills for a while now and decided to check out this new location last month. Ive been back 7 times since! The food is always delicious and the pancakes and crepes have never failed me. They have a bakery in the store too and bake their desserts fresh every day. We normally come in the mornings, service can be a little slow at times but never horrible. The staff is fun and quirky, I always hear a waitress laughing with their tables. Nix is one of my favorites, she is always upbeat and cheerful and makes me leave in a good mood after a big breakfast.       We decided to stop by for dinner this week for the first time to check it out. It was extremely busy and I was a little dissapointed we couldn't sit in our normal spot. Our server was Josh, he was very attentive and informative on their massive 16 page menu. He knew the prices on everything we asked off the top of his head , and let us know how we could save on some money by deluxing our pancakes and meals(we added it up and we saved $13.78!!). Our side salads came out quickly and we were offered dinner rolls AND corn bread (I had no idea they had these?!). The food took almost 40mins to arrive after placing our order but it came out pipin hot and everything was delicious. Our server checked in on us twice after we started eating but I noticed the poor boy(looked 18) was practically jogging taking orders, serving food, making salads, seating people, working the register, and carrying plates of food all over the store. I got the feeling the store was under staffed... I only saw 4 employees with the store fully packed.       Overall I would have to say I love the place. Its by no means the best place out there but it's definitely worth checking out. Great food, good prices, and a hard working staff is all I can ask for

k0R4U0QzF3jRZT-Og0rIEQ.text: Best pancakes! This place is a great off the strip breakfast joint! Service was great and was seated quickly! excellent!

APx7xKhve8_2pbL-xUjEhA.text: The disaster started before we even walked in the door. We couldn't figure out where the entrance was due to no signage. We tried three different doors until we figured it out. We were seated within ten minutes even with it being moderately busy. After we were seated someone asked if we would like coffee and we put our cups out and only one was poured and the lady simply walked away with no explanation and did not let us order our daughters drink. Once the waiter, Cesar, came over he explained it was brewing which was completely fine with us. We ordered around 12:20 and then didn't get our food until almost one. The ticket time was way over what it should have been, and then we got our food and didn't even get all that we had ordered. We were missing a plate of pancakes but no one ever came by to check on us so I had to get up from the table and go find another server to bring the rest of the food as well as syrup we had requested before we ate. When our waiter found out we were missing food he brought out the pancakes and said "they were not ready that's why I didn't bring them out". It was extremely rude and he never once apologized or checked on us. Luckily the manager was willing to discount some of our food. If Cesar would have just apologized and checked on us, this would have never happened. I'm a server myself so I'm very patient but this was completely unacceptable and rude. We would have even ordered dessert if we would have been treated well!!! Unfortunately I will not be returning because of the awful service. The only reason that I give two stars is because the food was decent and the manager did discount our bill for the service and timing.

pgKaI-uxYjT2PMtoQcfq_A.text: I am very disappointed in the service here and especially with the customer service. We went on Saturday January 15 and we had a party of 5. From the time we walked in, we felt an unwelcoming feeling.  Plenty of the waiters and persons working in that late morning/ afternoon shift were very unpleasant. Our waiter was Tammy and she was by far the worst waiter I ever came across in my life. She wasn't welcoming. Her attitude came off as she didn't even want to be there at work. We were very polite and she still was cold and mean. She was very aggressive with her responses. We ordered a omelette and it came half cooked. When I mentioned it to Tammy she rudely said " What do you want me to do with it?"  and rolled her eyes.I was startled with that response. I felt very insulted and I had to tell her three times to take it back. I told her to please take it back and bring me a menu. Grabbed the plate and ran off with it. She never brought back the menu. Since she never brought the menu I requested to just make eggs and some bacon. She comes back with it and slams it on the table and walks off. She never came back and asked if the food was okay and if there was something else we needed. We were low on water, juices and she never came back. Then she comes with the checks and slams it on the table in between the  menus and said "Here you go, Bye." There were five separate checks and we couldn't even read who's bill was what. She didn't even have the courtesy to hand out our separate checks. We had to ask another waiter what was the process of paying because she never came back. We then saw her and told her if we can have boxes. My friend was trying to ask  her something as well and she just walked away. We had to ask another waiter to bring what we needed.  Tammy was very disappointing and I will never recommend anyone to this location and to deal with the horrible customer service that we went through. At this point we felt enough was enough and told Tammy to bring her manger to speak with us. The manager then comes and she was very nice and was able to help with the situation.

DXlRAw2NSu-mSnWOsWX5Yg.text: Excellent "off the strip" breakfast!  We were looking for something on our way out of town and came across this restaurant.  The food was fresh and delicious!  Service was excellent and the place is clean and bright.  We ordered: huevos rancheros, French toast with bacon, and a chorizo omelette.  The portions were perfect for 3 hungry adults.  Even our teen daughter finished her French toast and bacon (she doesn't normally eat a lot).  We left feeling satisfied and not sickly full.

UdJrn4UT6epBgq1sG_cTgA.text: we go here about one a month ... turkey dinner $12.49  ... called for thanksgiving hours ... they are raising turkey price to $15.49 for the holiday  ... wait until i tell my senior friends!   .... what a rip off

y3A8unxzeBEJLQwNUfbk_Q.text: Horrible, like the Walmart of diners.  Took 8 minutes to clear a space at the bar, which was pretty much empty. 20 minutes to bring out a very mediocre omelette Amazingly disinterested female bartender.. And the Mimosa at 7 bucks are horrible, no taste and no zip.  NOT a good deal, when las Vegas is full of cool restaurants to choose from.  Avoid at all cost

1_N3g7RYZbMhCTfbx6EXAQ.text: Went for a late breakfast on a Monday. I got the breakfast with the burger and potato pancakes. My daughter pancakes with eggs, sausage. I was hesitant to go because of the  bad reviews, but it's just across the street. We were seated promptly and got our drinks soon after. The menu is a bit extensive.  So many choices.  After ordering we didn't  wait long. They brought the wrong  order. (A little confused because the orders were somewhat similar). A few minutes later we rec'd the correct meal. The servings are hearty and the eggs were perfect. The potato pancakes were actually pancakes with shredded potatoes cooked in. Different, but I liked it. My daughter loved the pancakes. Big and fluffy. The food was good  and except the earlier glitch, the service excellent.  We'll be returning.

3rgHnf3Vv0YlTNPc46rRxg.text: I used to live in Los Angeles, CA  and every other month i would visit my friends in Las Vegas, and come to Blueberry Hill  on Decatur just to be served by the nicest waitress Tammy! I will not eat anywhere else in the mornings but that place , and we would always wait however long it would take just to get seated with Tammy!! well Tammy moved to another location on Flamingo and yep you guessed it, we now always go there! I have since moved to the Reno/Tahoe area and yes i am still only going to her location whenever i visit. She is always such a sweetheart and always gets our dishes out promptly and with a smile. I tell everyone i know when they are going to Las Vegas to make sure to go there and ALWAYS ask for Tammy!!! luv her and luv the food! never a bad experience

DYbENDq0MNbqfZTWFNtV9g.text: Went here after we had a terrible experience at Las Vegas Little Theater. We aren't familiar with this area of town, so we cruised around. We saw that this had replaced Marie Calendar's, and my boyfriend read the reviews were good (turns out he read the Yelp reviews for a different location). So we decided to try here. I ordered two cheese enchiladas, my mom ordered a chimichanga, and my boyfriend ordered a bacon burger. My boyfriend loved it, but my mom and I thought ours were disgusting. The sauce on the enchilada was so strange... I don't even know how to describe it. The "shell" on the enchilada tasted and looked fake. My mom's chimichanga was full of peppers and onions. Refried beans were good. I was hungry and we bought it so I ate it. My mom ate a little of hers. Long story short, we all ran to the bathroom when we returned home. I still feel sick to my stomach. Only reason I'm giving 2 stars and not 1 is because the waiters were nice. Bottom line? Don't go here if you want a good meal and a happy stomach after.

VfFvB2lQqEnKquzJpzLbQg.text: The people (at least the ones I follow - Jessica, Josh and Cesar) are still there and still excellent.  The food preparation has taken a hit recently; it's not as good as it used to be (seems like the cook staff is getting lazy), and the management is just plain apathetic.  The last three times the Orchid and I were in this place, there was one or more annoying, abrasive or just plain rude party making everyone else's lives miserable.  Now, we are aware that the trend in service management these days is to ignore the jerks and make the polite people bear it or leave.  We have in the past made comment to the management staff concerning the screeching children, the loud-to-the-point-of-pain raucous laughter, and the foul language of certain parties.  My mother, the most honorable Mama Hawk, and the politest person I know, attempted to light-heeartedly bring to the attention of the mother of the screeching child that he was causing the patrons around them to not enjoy their meal; this woman started screaming at my 88-year-old mother, complete with a litany of her "right" to eat wherever she pleased, and threats to my mother's health and well-being.  When management was notified of this incident, it was suggested that WE leave, as if we had been the offending party.  Jessica, Josh and Cesar - you've always been great, and we will miss you. Sylvia (management staff) - your attmept to insert yourself into the conversation I had with the other member of staff was unwelcome.  You don't know our family's history with the Blueberry Hill organization, nor do you know what really transpired the last three times we patronized your restaurant.  (For that matter, you don't know anything about the eight years we've done business with the Hill.)  You are not entitled to an opinion, and anything you attempted to say was unwelcome, unqualified, and, frankly, irrelevant. Male member of management staff (I think your name is "Steve:"  I thank you for listening to our complaint this time, but your droopy, three-quarters-asleep eyes gave me the impressuion that you were either too tired to be on duty or that you really didn't care what we thought.  So ... this will be the last time we patronize Blueberry Hill.  One star because Yelp says I can't give a zero but that's how I count it), and one for the three memebers of wait staff who do a wonderful job in spite of the environment they are forced to work in.  On the Nighthawk 100-point scale: 15 ... five points for each of three wonderful servers.

2eAXdYkGaQc0-r6MubuZvA.text: I don't normally post Yelp reviews and when I do it's always positive.  I feel like I would be doing a disservice to Blueberry Hill and it's possible patrons if I don't post a review on my recent visit.  First and foremost....PLEASE REMOVE the turkey dinner from your menu!  I've only been to your restaurant a couple of times and ordered breakfast both times.  In addition in both cases I visited the Decatur/W Charleston location.  I wouldn't have anything negative to say about my two previous visits.  On my most recent visit my husband and I stopped for a quick dinner on our way to a concert.  I love to have a traditional turkey dinner and have ordered that item at other restaurants with great enjoyment.  However on this occasion it was a colossal mistake.  Let me start with the gravy that covered every inch of my plate, first of all it was clear!  It had a weird gelatinous consistency and absolutely no flavor, matter of fact the entire dish had no flavor at all, I had to add salt and pepper to everything.  The stuffing, if you can call it that, was basically soggy bread crumbs.  The turkey was piled high but I'd prefer quality over quantity, although very dry it was at least edible once I scraped the gravy off.  The mashed potatoes were also edible without the gravy.  The corn was definitely straight out of a can but it was really the only item on the plate that I ate almost entirely.  I only wish I had taken a picture for further proof of just how horrible this menu item was.  If there were such thing as zero stars that what I would have given.  I implore Blueberry Hill to either remove or revamp this menu item.  On a positive note the Oreo cookie cake was very good.  But Being that my husbands meal, although edible wasn't much better than mine we've both vowed to NEVER eat at Blueberry Hill again.

a2tj-AE26DORaWvAFvXrdw.text: Service was great, coffee great,  breakfast was solid,  and location was easy to find. Menu selection was a bit bloated. Way too many choices. Normally with a menu of this size, quality will drop. Not in the case of this restaurant.  Well done!

i0vnvrLJLYnzoof9-ABHrg.text: Great food, everything looks so yummy and everything tasted delicious! I will be returning time after time to try everything on their menu! Oh and the service, super friendly, great at advising/suggesting (they know there menu well), and very fun. This is truly a nice family experience in some really great food and service.

mm3SqFRBOzTJLEcqOJAOsw.text: Some of the best food in Vegas. We had an amazing breakfast at a reasonable price, with great/quick service. We would absolutely come back here! The Guadalajara breakfast skillet was the best skillet I have had in a long time and the hand made sweets were delicious!

bgcUJ5IcV8I1PVwvjgXtaw.text: Great selection of everything but breakfast menu is the best. Excellent customer service.

2rqIHN2nbNqlA4AJLqWR-A.text: A Las Vegas classic diner joint, the newest location, I was pumped to try an old favorite I hadn't visited in a long time.   We were seated quickly. It took us a while to peruse the HUMONGOUS menu. I settled on a plate for my kids to share and they also got pancakes.   I confirmed with the waitress that it would be a big serving. Our two meals came out in three stages, pancakes, 7 minutes, my meal,  10 minutes, their meal.   Their meal was not a big serving, but the pancakes were. Their scrambled eggs were sloppy and kinda wet. The presentation blech, but kids ate it since they had to to obtain pancake heaven.  My potato pancake Benedict was awesome, but stingy on the hollandaise, one poached egg had about 1 tablespoon of sauce.   It was delicious, though. Top notch, just, I'll get more sauce next time.  Bill was just over $30....I found that high for two meals, one coffee, and two kids sized milks.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge new menu....it was very busy.   Let&#39;s hope it&#39;s worth the slightly higher than expected prices.   Only slightly....

swupGRJW4Netgcc_sRTuOg.text: Food and service was amazing!! Highly recommend. Best french toast and homemade hash browns ever. If you are in the area, you should definitely have breakfast here.

i_UUtxv2953uINxNWfuvxQ.text: eh...just ok. Went for breakfast. Place maybe had 3 customers and service was slow. Our waitress was a little quirky. Food was just ok. bacon way overcooked, pancakes are good, but really thick. Don't get the chunky potatoes, they are undercooked and flavorless.. honestly we have better breakfast at farmer boys and for half the price

Y3SweS-nFKvKTEXKrHMhiQ.text: Went two days in a row. The first day was disappointing. I got the steak omelet, hash browns and toast. Something was off with the seasoning. The steak was poor quality and the hash browns had a greening hue to them. I went back to try the honey coconut chicken and waffles which many had recommended on yelp. It was good but the chicken could use a bit more seasoning.

tPaZzDjsoyRE8GztOUXn6g.text: I came here with my family on Palm Sunday last week after church. It was super busy, but we were seated within 7 minutes. The lady at the front when you walk in, and the lady who served us were both very kind and accomodating. This location was lively, filled with families. The decatur and charleston location isn't as full of energy just because of the crowd which is mostly seniors or office workers. Their restroom here was clean, unlike the location on flamingo and maryland. I ordered the Chicken Cutlets and Spinach Fettuccine Alfredo. It was mouth-watering and juicy, full of flavor but not too salty nor greasy.   One thing though, there was a 1x1cm piece of plastic in my fettuccine. Please be careful.

YxaKMXnNUNcJ3nZbq9w-SQ.text: Have to say great escape from the strip ..food was awesome..a little noisy....but all around a GREAT place .highly recommended.

ggFNsq3RptImmdscyWD3BQ.text: I ate here for a late night snack and for a brunch one morning. Both were great experiences with good food and good service.  The pancakes are out of this world!

cfDv0ooo6aGS4Z80W_TvzA.text: Tammy Sue, awesome girl, very friendly, great customer service, and hard working!! We will be back

xSQcAMZVN2Z0i8Ebt3iTZw.text: Breakfast was good I wouldn't say it's the best place to have breakfast but it was okay food. I wouldn't think I would stop by again but it was worth a try.

hj-7Ih9Q8KV2HrQoUC1m2A.text: This place is great for late night dining when you can't decide what you want. They have everything! So many choices and desserts! Cakes and pies! Our server was very friendly and sociable she even hooked us up with some free pie :) try the blueberry muffin its delicious and comes free with breakfast

BSPb3Mp77oBvLYHafN4c8g.text: Don was our server.  The was much better than our last visit. I had the chicken cutlet with spinach Alfredo.  The chicken was great the Alfredo yummy.  The service and good was 100 percent better than last visit.

7YtZ4SCZN6pdVEzJvS5O8g.text: Our waitress Lily was amazing. The food was excellent. By far the best dining experience of our whole trip. We did the whole buffet thing...it's ok. We ended up going back to blueberry hill for lunch and were ecstatic to see lily again. I can't stress enough what a great place and experience this was. We will always come back! Thanks again lily...you are awesome!!!

WKvFbMfsDNBnn6dUi0ppqA.text: Arrived for my lunch break at 2:00 was sat immediately, no waitress for 10mins we ask bus boy to find one, was advised one is on the way, waited additional 10mins then left, on the way out advised manager or whomever sat us that we're leaving because no waitress came, by he didn't seem too concerned

VHaANT0jEVtOb6mLv873Ig.text: Very clean, excellent food and the service is fast.  We came for breakfast 4 days in a row.  Way above the competition.

R0vhYZ-2Gzk0B-h7LnFolw.text: It's like every day we are town visiting we have to have breakfast here. Mmmmmm #goodfood #getinmybelly #shouldawornsweats.

olXIGBxplsetMgOJB_YHzA.text: Best specialty menu, with choice of soup, salad, and coffee or soft drink, and USDA Meat entry, plus homemade dessert! For 10 bucks! Great taste as well.

vRnZTIL_KID34Mi1TdoOQw.text: Very unique place to eat. Came here with my family and I will say the food was delicious. Employees had great customer service, I even ask what would they recommend and they were kind of enough to over the menu with my family. Very fantastic experience for my first visit thank you I definitely will be back.

k_qvuljoDOtNvJOVN6W8NA.text: I like the food here it's so good.  I love the service here as well. What I don't like is the hair in my food. Seriously. I went years ago and had a hair in my honey coconut chicken so I stopped going.  Recently a friend suggested going there so I thought I'd give it a try. Basically in two weeks I have been here 3 times. All three times I asked if the carrot cake has buttercream or cream cheese frosting, NO ONE KNOWS! I get varying answers so last night the hostess offered me a very small slice, paper thin so I could find out, because carrot cake can only have cream cheese frosting or I won't eat it. But in this paper thin slice what did I find? A BLACK HAIR. A fairly decent sized one. Luckily I saw it first thing, I pointed it out and said hopefully the rest of the cake isn't like that. At this point I simply don't care what kind of frosting it is because I will sadly NEVER go again.  The cook I saw behind the line wasn't wearing a hair net or a hat either.  Sorry but when I have only been to a place maybe six or seven times in my life, years apart and I get hair in food twice it makes you wonder how much hair are you consuming that you don't catch.  Never again!!! Sorry not sorry.

IhtBUbAAN44spq28Do0BFw.text: Came here for breakfast on Saturday & there was a wait, but it went fast.  The host was a really friendly guy who seemed to really enjoy his job. Hubby & I both ordered the mini veggie omelet with 2 pancakes special and it was not a MINI omelet! Probably more like 3 eggs, loaded with mushrooms, onions, green peppers and, the best part, small dice cheddar cheese (instead of shreds either in the middle or thrown on top), which gave you a tiny taste of salty cheese with each bite of omelet. The pancakes were fluffy. A lot of food for $8.99. Even tho they were very busy, our waitress was very friendly, and kept our coffee cups filled! So much better than overpriced hotel food!

FYiu8sMeFzb7w66k0AVeZg.text: The secret restaurant for locals and only a short distance from the strip. Best for 24 hour breakfast and lunch. The baked on premises cakes and pies are humongous and always fresh. Their buttermilk pancakes are famous. How ever I prefer their french toast ...the best this side of the moon.Eggs Benedict are offered 4 different ways...one of my other favorites here.  I've been here a thousand thousand times. Any time I'm in the area I'll be headed there.

MVBpMR-dsRsc0ovkNYS_yQ.text: This place had slow service.   The pancakes are really fluffy and one of the better pancake places. The Monte cristo sandwich was Like 2 stars it is not deep fried with the battered.  It didn't have enough taste for my buds. Refills were slow.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon eggs and potatoes
Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monte cristo sanwich with onion rings.

BaY3vRf23elfMxQW8jfk1Q.text: Large, clean new location- they have the same menu and massive portions as the other locations, but I felt the staff was a little less friendly, lacked the character found at other locations.   The breakfast offerings are reliably good, but I usually only come here for desserts: the fresh fruit crepes with just strawberries and powdered sugar, no whip or cheese, are the best. Light, fluffy crepes packed with tons of fresh strawberries- super healthy, shareable portion, about $12.

lmc0gTFGpTCV2G_qgo6UWw.text: It's pretty good, but also pretty expensive. I recommend ihop or baby stacks. Don't recommend if ur a vegetarian because it's really expensive.

7MGAIOLtg6N1j7bD2Y_cdg.text: Great place. Price is just right, come hungry because they feed you and there is t anything I wouldn't recommend. Coffee and salsa is delicious, staff is very attentive, the restaurant and restrooms are clean. Overall a great place.

InEDrKdj9qn0X2pwrA0E_w.text: Went in today with a huge party, and we received our food quickly and had no issues! The waitress was so friendly and met all of our needs. The food was delicious and you get a lot of food for the price! Awesome family restaurant. We have five young kids and they had crayons and coloring pages for the kids as well as brought us crackers prior to our food coming. Highly recommended!

HG52eeSNm51Lp69QlX1XtA.text: Definitely a newer location than the other Blueberry Hills. Ordered the turkey BLT club and it's huge. I was stuffed after half the sandwich. It could have used some more mayo though, was a little dry. But the ingredients were good.  Service was friendly and attentive, establishment is clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey BLT club on rye. Maybe ask for extra mayo since rye bread is a little dryer than white or wheat.

0fhTVGGpt02JBe9EQP9jfQ.text: I've driven by this place countless times and never gave it much thought. The building was renovated a couple years back and the interior looks great -- reminiscent of bakeries/cafes out east with dark wood accents and floral cushions. The place is spacious with comfortable booths found throughout and TVs scattered around the dining room. It's not just a breakfast spot either, their extensive menu spans breakfast, lunch and dinner with a decidedly American bent, but plenty of options like Mexican and Italian fare.   Their version of chicken and waffles ($9.79) consists of four small and breaded, coconut chicken tenders with just enough coconut flavor to taste without dominating the flavor. The waffle was pretty basic, but after pouring syrup on everything, it was delicious. Potato pancakes ($8.79) were pretty much giant hash browns. Three of them nicely fried and crispy. An order of kid's chocolate chip pancakes ($5.69) was massive. Much larger than any kid should eat and definitely large enough for 3 kids to share. The pancakes have chocolate in the batter and are topped with chocolate chips and whipped cream. Clearly this isn't a healthy choice, but fuck it... I have a sweet tooth and so does my kid.  Service was less than stellar with a grumpy older lady taking our orders and occasionally checking back on us. For those who don't want to sit at a table or booth, there's a bar area just inside the main dining room.   3.5 Stars

q5bSguxEwR-cR1xKY5Tq2Q.text: I really enjoyed my experience at this location that is closer to my condo. We visited on Christmas night and we each ordered the Holiday special.   I ordered the classic turkey dinner which was $12.99 for a complete turkey dinner which included, soup or salad, drink and any dessert! The sage stuffing was delicious and the gravy was so tasty! They really packed on the turkey which was tender along with stuffing, mashed taters and corn.  My guest ordered the cherry glazed Ham dinner which included, soup or salad, drink and any dessert for $12.99.  This was a lot of food and both of our meals were delicious! This was a Holiday special keep in mind however I would make a visit even if not a holiday to have a turkey dinner which is always on their menu!  I really enjoyed this new location as it was clean, bright and comfortable.  The dessert counter looks Amazing as you walk in the front door. The hardest part was deciding on what dessert to order at the end which we asked them to pack up to go.  We will be back for sure to enjoy a nice restaurant meal and experience!

IYmP0KPRJRBRxf3cVd-1lQ.text: I've eaten here before and the food was good but these last three time were all epic fails! I don't know if they got a new chef or vendor or both. My bacon was sooo salty I couldn't eat it. The meatloaf and potatoes were Luke warm. The corn was good. The chili was a disaster! Chili made with pork n beans???? Disgusting!! CFGsl_Bs-PSBAaX66KiXug.text: I have been to the location up on Decatur and this one. This is a much nicer restaurant on the inside (mainly because it is newer), and the food is just as pleasant. I enjoy their pancakes and breakfast very much. I also like some of their lunch options. On my last visit, I enjoyed the patty melt. The only down side is the onions were not a cooked as I like and some were very crunchy. I am used to the onions on the patty melt being cooked until soft. Other than that it was good. This by far is not a phenomenal place to eat, but it does the trick especially at breakfast. I would recommend it if you want breakfast and diner style food, but if you are looking for the best of the best this is not your place. We will be back from time to time.

Lt-118L8NkVCEqCKT0AwiQ.text: Great food and friendly service  If you are looking for a good breakfast place that won't break the bank check this place out. QGMyG0r-rT_S4jyBNU0WSw.text: Came here with high hopes.  My pregnant wife was craving pork chops. After reading reviews of best pork chops in Las Vegas it was decided blueberry hill was the place to go.  It's a nice family restaurant with the expected atmosphere. The wait staff was very nice. Back to the pork chops, they are offered two different ways. You get two when you order and since my wife didn't know Erich way would taste best she asked if she could get one of both. We were told they normally don't do that, but since it was slow she would ask. The waitress didn't come back so we assumed it was ok. Our food came out and there we two of the breaded pork chops. That's when we were told that they wouldn't do one of each. That's understandable, but it would have been nice if she would have asked my wife which way she preferred them. The pork chops were bland and unevenly cooked. She had to douse the potatoes and gravy on top of the chops just to get them down. Sad to say they didn't hit the spot.  I ordered the Oreo chocolate pancakes that were VERY rich and sweet. I enjoyed what I could.  There were other service issues, however, the waitress seemed to know we weren't satisfied and tried to make up for it the best she could.  Bottomline, the service was pretty good, meat portions not so much.

D5RM2XgJkcpC5hiwfEgs7g.text: The food WAS Good at one time, but when You have incompetent wait staff & management at this particular location, who constantly & consistently get orders incorrect, especially those who have food allergies,  I will NOT patronize this location EVER AGAIN.  To make matters worse, complaining to the Manager was to no avail, and made no offer to rectify the Issue.  I will  be in contact with their Corporate offices immediately tomorrow.

eMMp-sprPKlMQf5fggXXgQ.text: Although the restaurant was very clean with decent service, it was very pricey for some mediocre food and bland hot chocolate. We and a couple of friends ordered the three fruit crepes with warm compote, chicken fettuccine, and chicken fried steak.   Crepes- Weren't too satisfied with the artificial flavored syrup and coloring.  Chicken Fettuccine- Chicken was lacking seasoning, not very tasteful.  We don't believe we would return back here in the near future.

xot3pH68wV5H15Ikfdi3uQ.text: I've been coming to Blueberry Hill for 27 years, and this location keeps the tradition alive! Delicious fresh food from scratch, a huge menu accommodating to any persons taste or craving for that day, and their orange cake is to DIE FOR. If you're there at night, ask for Rachael. She's the sweetest!

t-N9bUXEPFRHy-NcAdTpew.text: I am a GrubHub driver who had a very nasty encounter with the manager, who later said he was the owner, of this location, Steve. Upon arriving to the restaurant, I checked in with them to let them know I was there to pick up. The person working the counter didn't ask who the order was for or anything, just said "oh it will be a few minutes." After waiting for over 30 minutes, I approached Steve at the hostess counter and confirmed he was the manager. After simply asking what was taking the order so long, he proceeded to be very rude and say things like "well I have over 100 customers in here right now" and "Maybe you shouldn't accept orders from us next time"and "Grubhub isn't the only delivery platform so I'll just cancel" I was trying to remain professional during this whole thing but Steve made it impossible to do so. What he should of said was "let me check on that for you." But no, instead Steve was very unprofessional. After I asked another employee if the order was done, he put his hands on my shoulders in an attempt to move me out of public eye and into the kitchen. After instructing Steve to not put his hands on me, I willingly moved into the kitchen to hopefully get an answer.  Steve then claims to be the owner of all Blueberry Hill locations all of sudden and brings the employee that supposedly takes the online orders into the situation and she proceeds to verbally attack me even though I never said a word to her. Come to find out, the customer's food had been sitting on the kitchen out window the whole time I was there from the beginning.

BzxjMfTwa-nKGbaPIKtbBg.text: Went there for breakfast on 8/28/16 and 8/29/2016.  For breakfast that was pretty standard menu.  I would have given the place 3 stars, except of what happened on my first morning there. I was really looking forward for a breakfast burrito, and didn't see any on the menu. I asked the server about it and she said they could make me one. Yes!! Turns out it was exactly what I was looking for, it was great! I asked her why it's not on the menu and she said that it used to be but got removed at some point. She suggested I write a Yelp review to make the owners aware. So owners, you are now aware :)  I returned the next day and had the veggie omelet: it was good and crunchy from the brocoli and carrots. Wish it had more onion.  Service was exactly what I expected.

kjyR-Y5qEn1SM6Qse1Df8g.text: I had the same experience as another of your reviewers. Came in for lunch,  sat waiting for a server for more than 10 minutes. Food was tasty, but the only time my server came by to check on me was to take my payment so she could go off shift. From then on I was on my own. xw6T6ByREVxm0uxi9OSFuw.text: This place has mediocre food and has terrible customer service from the server/waitress. My father and I come here to eat breakfast at 9:30am then the hostess kindly sits us in a booth. We had to ask the backup server for water/coffee. Our waitress on the other hand completely ignored us and we asked her if she would take our order, since we were waiting for 20 minutes now, she bluntly said, "No, I'm busy with my tables you can wait." That's when my father and I immediately left to 'Egg & I'. I work a restaurant and there is no way that I'm going to respond to a customer in such a way that this waitress did let alone make them wait for 20 minutes just to place an order. Thay apologized about the employee and took care of the situation also they sent us a gift card for our next visit. Thank you again Blueberry Hill,  we appreciate your company and oncw again you are one of our favorite eatery!

wFfWzrpP3h_yCkyN0HdgtA.text: My friend and I walked in at 11am on Sunday 11/22/15 and were seated right away in a big comfy booth. This surprised me though because there were plenty of people waiting in the lobby, but I can only assume they were larger parties.  Blueberry Hill has one of the LARGEST menu's I have ever seen. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner and are open 24/7. The breakfast menu alone is around 4 pages long. I am the most indecisive person, so it took me some time to figure out what I wanted. I finally decided to get the chicken fried steak which comes with hash browns, eggs and toast. My friend got the Irish eggs benedict. Our server was nice but I didn't even get her name. She just kinda wandered by and took our order. Someone else brought us our coffee and water. I am not complaining, just saying that it felt a lot more informal than I am used to at most restaurants.  The food came out quickly and everything was delicious. I really enjoyed the chicken fried steak, and the gravy that came on top was really good. This place is also a bakery, and they have delicious cakes and pies for sale.

wukToNem1WC_P6kQ06VQ_w.text: Came here early in the morning 5 am ish after a night of balls to the wall fun & mischief, which shockingly always seems to leave me much poorer, but at least not in jail thank the Lord!  At the very least, I will have great stories to tell in 40 years to regale my future geriatric friends and Grandkids in the Nursing Home before I join the great mischief maker and Chief in the Sky...  But now the Food!!!  I ordered the combo with steak, eggs and pancakes and a piece of apple pie from the best waitress this side of Heaven! If she hadn't been married and me being marriage adverse...I would of proposed on the spot and gone to visit Elvis downtown. She knew how to make a Man happy!  I really enjoyed the Steak, it was covered with grilled onions it was tender easy to cut and chew and packed with flavor. I had the scrambled Eggs they were fine as well...I didn't have any more room for the Pancakes and they did look dead sexy at the time.  The waitress said they are the best pancakes in Vegas, I will have to take her word on that because heating them up 24 hours later in the Microwave they were well...not so great.  The Dutch Apple Pie slice, she recommended to me as I was paying my bill was fanlickentastic. I want to go back an order a full pie ASAP!    As the King would say, "Gimme some Sugar Baby"

8GVbNrwgD1ddAZ_erXA0XQ.text: Pancakes and waffles were fluffy and tasty! Hardly needed syrup. We will be going back for sure.

6czDxPv5Ni5v1jI7jkn9LA.text: Busy Sunday ....the wait was short, though.  We were served coffee and iced tea right away and our waitress, Bonney, stopped by to say she would be with us shortly.    Bonney was helpful with menu advice when asked.... thanks!   Ernie had the Meat Lovers Skillet and gives it a thumbs up.   I couldn't decide between a strawberry waffle or eggs -- Bonney said I could have both, LOL.   definitely have the HamSteak!  It was great--bone in and grilled nicely.   We will be back when in town.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AUalN1ACQwBzY6VCNM8RFg.text: Just a few minutes off the main drag lies a hidden gem of a restaurant known as Blueberry Hill. And it's damn delicious. I love the cozy vibe inside this place. It's like a diner ate another diner and created this place. Loads of seating. We got in for brunch on a Saturday with no wait at around noon. WINNER.  The menu is ridiculous. And by that I mean ridiculously GOOD. I love options, especially when they're all within the same style of cooking (i.e. they don't overreach). This place delivers a ton of variations of classic American diner dishes that make my mouth water.   POTATO PANCAKE EGGS BENEDICT. If you are in any way a lover of poached eggs in hollandaise sauce, this is it, man. I misread the description and assumed that the English muffin was replaced by the potato pancake, but you get BOTH. Carbs upon carbs upon carbs to wash away my bad decisions. Or maybe yours. I don't really drink. But this is the ultimate hangover cure. That hollandaise sauce is bomb. Perfectly poached eggs. Potato pancake that makes my Jewy heart sing. English muffin lost in all the madness, but swimming in yolk and sauce and deliciousness. Oh yeah, and there was fruit somewhere on the side. I left a very clean plate that would make my grandmother proud.   And of course I tried all my friends' plates; isn't that normal?   Fries and ranch: what the fuck is in this crack ranch?! IT'S SO GOOD. I didn't even need the fries so much as my finger, but let's face it, I'm a somewhat classy lady. I couldn't do that. Not with so many occupied tables nearby. -_-  Biscuits and Gravy: ENORMOUS portion! Enough to feed a linebacker. Biscuits so fluffy, I could sleep on them. Gravy so divine, I felt like I was in the south.   Chocolate chip pancakes: one of the lesser indulgences on their sweet menu, but my friend didn't leave a bite on that plate. Plus points for serving sugar-free maple syrup so he could pretend like he wasn't one step closer to full-blown Diabetes for polishing off that meal.   Service was so excellent. Our server, whose name I have now forgotten since it's been a few weeks, was on top of his game. Super friendly. Chatted with us about lots of random stuff. The meal was very reasonably-priced and I left feeling like I had made the best decision of our whole trip by coming here. What  can I say? I love food.  My only thought once we drove away was: "WHY DIDN'T WE GET PIE?!?!"

0a191Zg9xgAhF6nJzNktrw.text: After searching hi and low (I asked a local where to get good local breakfast).  He said, "Blueberry Hill."  So my colleauge joined me and off we went and called Uber.  In 20 minutes, we got to Blueberry, sat down and ordered a nice homemade meal. I'd have to say their chicken waffles was really good.  Chicken was very crunchy and moist. Even their black coffee was not too bad (and for being a coffee connoisseur, you get my drift).  Overall, service was excellent, our waiter (he must have been with Blueberry Hills for quite a while) because he had a lot of stories about Vegas oh years ago!!  I think before I was even born!!  Hahahah :p  By the way, that was the highlight of our visit.  He was such a cool guy!  We would come back just for his stories and his great optimism of life!  Until then, be kind to one another and Cheers! ~ :p

wvL-oygO9diN1dIhjCMPxQ.text: When I first came to Las Vegas seven years ago I ate at the BH on Decatur at Charleston. It was disastrous. Another year or two went by and I figured that it was a fluke. No, no, I had an almost identical experience and said, "Never again!"   Now, years later, I was talked into going to a different BH on West Flamingo.   This is what happened: The table staff started to pour coffee into a cup that was clearly dirty. The staff was looking directly into the cup and beginning to pour when I pointed out how dirty the cup was.   Back with a new cup, he filled it and left. I looked around the table for some Half and Half and there wasn't any. Lots of chemical choices but I don't like the aftertaste. I had to wait a considerable time to get H&H and by then my coffee was cold.   The restroom: Only one toilet (!) and it was filthy. I haven't felt the need to use a tissue toilet seat cover for probably 30 years but I had to at BH.  Then the hand dryer just made a little rattling noise and put out no air.  Bye, this time for good. There is no excuse for this level of institutional ineptitude and mismanagement.

bquBykZICDo7xDWykidfgA.text: Great food. Loved it. The services are good too. Never disappointed me. Classic interior design. Great way to start the morning

ucwJCGJwRmWnziI860ndjg.text: Simply the best!!!! Very busy place! Food was fast and high quality! Can't wait to go again. Service was excellent as well.

nSe1OUGv7sc8sQx4LiEbrw.text: Love love everything about this restaurant! Lovely decor and staff!   Pro:   We were seated pretty fast in which we thought this place would be packed like other breakfast spots but this is a total gem!   They have a bar set up where you can eat as well with huge screen tvs!   The food and wait time was great! Food was sooo delicious and flavorful! Came hungry and left full!

Good quality. I had a Meat lovers skillet wmushrooms. Can't wait to heat my leftovers! Our friends loved it too. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because we had to track down our waitress a few times. Even to get the bill. Upside is she was really helpful when we saw her. Can't wait to go back.

dQMMoAUkqdL4FYelSzv8oQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant in town! It's always open, the food is always excellent, and it's cheap. As you walk in, there's many different desert options on display, just like Cheesecake Factory. This spot used to be a Marie Calenders, so I'm not sure if they're just taking advantage of the display cases that were already installed, or if they are filling the desert market that the closure of Marie Calenders left behind, but either way, it's awesome.  If you're a regular Blueberry Hill fan, this is the best location. It's the only one that serves alcohol. It's centrally located, and the go to place after a night of drinking and partying, especially if you still want to drink some more. During the day, the parking lot is quite busy, and that's a pain, but that's the only downside.   For pancake lovers, one tip I have is don't order the specialty pancakes by themselves, they're pretty expensive. Instead, order a dish that comes with pancakes then request the specialty ones instead. It only costs a little more, and you get the full meal too. It seem they have a dollar per customer number to hit, which of course, we all understand.

NPYY9oXfMv9T26J3CAE8TQ.text: Staple place to visit. This place makes IHOP and Dennys look like fool. Service is basic nothing special but you don't find here for that. The pancakes are to die for get them you won't be disappointed. Not sure I'd order anything else but breakfast here this is what they are known for.

GRWmgmpJlofmlb-FRNt7wA.text: I was not impressed at all with this place. Met a group of friends here for breakfast so I didn't pick this place out, but was looking forward to having something with blueberries. I ordered crepes but was terribly disappointed in the quality of them. Not light or tasty at all. They were way too thick and unfortunately served cold!! The blueberries were tasty but the crepes themselves were tasteless!

DdyDmu-XdkiKOXdyk5crMw.text: Do not order from here. I wanted a piece of cake. I'm in from out of town, no car, and my accommodations don't have a restaurant. So I used GrubHub. To get to the minimum delivery amount, I also ordered meatloaf, which came with a side; I chose chili. The order arrived. I got back to my room and there is no cake, the only thing I wanted.   I called the restaurant and Autumn tells me that she's absolutely sure that she packed the cake. I call the driver who says the woman didn't go over the order with her the way she usually does to ensure everything is there. I do the live chat with @Grubhub and they offered $3 for the cake.   After talking to the driver, I called the restaurant again. Autumn answers the phone and, lo and behold, her story has changed. Somehow, there were TWO orders at the same time of meatloaf with a side of chili and chocolate cake. What are the odds?! And because the restaurant was so busy, she put the chocolate cake in with the other order. Never an apology, never a "we'll get this right," just a "we were really busy and I put the cake in the other bag."   Interestingly, when GrubHub called me, the guy said Autumn told him that SHE wasn't the one who packed my order. It was now "the new girl" who doesn't know the difference between one container and two. The solution offered by the restaurant is that I could come in and get the cake THEY forgot to pack. Now... if I had wanted to go to a restaurant, why would I have used GrubHub in the first place? I'd spend more on a cab than the cake was worth.  I tried one bite of the meatloaf and it was dry and flavorless. Had I been in the restaurant, I would have sent it back. It was inedible. There are hundreds of restaurant in Las Vegas. Avoid this one.

7z8PMc99bWDFEcF-g8puOA.text: Here visiting from Atlanta and wanted something outside of The Strip. Drove pass this 24 hour location and it was worth the stop.  I ordered the mushroom & cheese omelet with pancakes. I was not disappointed. The omelet came with three pancakes, and they were huge!  The omelet was fluffy, very cheesy and didn't even need added seasoning.  OMG, these pancakes were heaven sent. Light, fluffy, REAL butter, and did I say huge!  I would definitely recommend this location if you have a vehicle. If not, it's accessible by public transportation or cab.   They make their own desserts and OMG!!!!!! If I had not gotten pancakes, I definitely would have gotten a slice of cake. Many options for those with a late night, early morning, or anytime sweet tooth.

kU65DbCgtBuvkx_NGpQp8g.text: Food was very good. Deserts are reportedly made on site. The taco salad was mostly meat and toppings instead of the usual lettuce filler with very little toppings. The cheesecake was as good or better than Cheesecake Factory. Altogether, a great dinner.

P5XOraV0r4EC1eKlZigN6g.text: The menu here is daunting. So much breakfast dishes I want to try.  It was a hard selection. The waitress, Barbara, raved about the biscuits. However, I went with the crepes because it just sounded ridiculous... it was ridiculous.  Food coma.... Zzzzzzz  Service was great. Coffee was okay.

QQ2y13hW1OzAZ4o5j68JGQ.text: I stopped in here twice for breakfast over the CES 2017 week in January.  Both times we were greeted by the lovely staff members and sat in the seats that we requested (once at the bar and once at a table with access to a power outlet).  The food is great and has that 'home cooked' feel to it.  Portions are HUGE so bear that in mind.  Both times we ordered different dishes and we said, we should have split everything.  Overall I am a fan and would recommend to anyone who wants a decent meal in a 'familiar' environment.  Get here early on the weekends though.  When we left on Saturday around 10am there were a number of groups waiting to be seated.

kySEUQIGGD8Oj_KxtW7cKQ.text: The food was ok. At best.. we ordered waffles and the pork chop. Asked for utensils and extra maple syrup nothing came in the delivery. Wound up eating dry waffles and pork chop with my hands.. when we called the restaurant they said they weren't responsible. And left me on hold till i hung up.

hn6NvCJgq0os9nmh_cf2oQ.text: I took my kids out to eat, and tried this location for the first time. I won't say it was the cheapest place ever. But you definitely get your money's worth, and then some. Our server was Xenia( I hope I spelled it right). She was very attentive and was very pleasant. I had plenty of food and then some to take home. My kids scarfed down there food. I will definitely come back. When I left and got home I realized that I left my phone. I drove back to the restaurant thinking it would not be there, still. However our waitress and Jessica had found it and held it for me. Thank you Soo much. I will be recommending this location. For its awesome food and exceptional service. Thank you

HVjKPoyMRRgiJ2QFDg2odQ.text: The service was really amazing... Lisa the server was very friendly and attentive! Well actually the Host and the person cleaning the tables were really helpful as well! My husband and I got the chicken and waffles with a side of curly fries.. so good! The food was fresh and delicious... I would definitely come back again!

20WjLMseJ0kQ1dWSVznP_w.text: This place was extremely well decorated from when you walk in and look around at the yummy bakery. However, the decorations does not prepare you for the food. Though the meal we consumed was what we could describe as "school cafeteria food." My guests had consumed the Italian meatloaf, there was almost no taste of seasonings, and the spaghetti had the taste of canned food. Our waiter was on top however until when it was time to get our receipt, she didn't come for almost 10 minutes. The desert was not the best either which was highly upsetting. Chocolate pie and strawberry cake was what we ate after. The pie had a weird after taste and the strawberry cake felt canned as well. The whipped cream was the best from these. Because of these, we might not ever return.

8jiDlMyQQ6LAS43E6CuYYA.text: One of my favorite places to get breakfast when heading home from Vegas.  It's always busy.  Very low key place,  nothing fancy.  Great  food and great service.

fTh5yqULugHmKCJ5zU0Zxg.text: Amazing place off the strip for breakfast. I loved it so much I came back the next day. I highly recommend the chicken and waffles. Grear prices for Vegas.

BBBFpVA1pspY2XPSgJEQMA.text: I eat here all the time (usually order breakfast foods), it puts IHOP and Denny's to shame. Food is always so good! I think this location is their nicest one. Service during the day is usually pretty good too.

QfEpfvR3q5D3yIugiRCpfw.text: I have visited this particular Resturant on 4 different occasions. I have absolutely loved the food and the service on every visit. The French toast will literally make you roll your eyeballs to the top of your skull because of the ecstasy on your tastebuds. They are the French Toast Dynasty!! I am relatively new to Las Vegas and Blueberry Hill is my personal breakfast SPOT!!

yiKRVrDchAKUkvvldTm6iA.text: My review has nothing to do with the food (which was excellent btw) or the waitress.  The host needs better training though... Walked in for dinner before trick or treating with my family which included myself, husband, nanny and two toddler children. We all had our costumes on (hello it's Halloween) immediately the host informed me we she couldn't seat us because there were no masks allowed in the restaurant so I offered to pull it up to my hair (like a headband) to which she immediately said she'd have to check with her manager and let me know. In the meanwhile my children start wondering what we did wrong. The host comes back and says that we need to pull our masks completely off our face/heads and then we could be seated. I understand that for safety reasons lone masked people should probably be asked to take off their masks but I had two toddlers ! What did they think we were going to do ? Perhaps they should close this location for Halloween if they can't use their common sense that a mom with two kids under five isn't going to hold them up for some pancakes.  The waitress apologized but the host had already taken our happy vibes away. That sucks

L7KvDahvt5ZiPfPiNuRRMg.text: We met up with some friends that were in Vegas at the same time.  They had spent a few years in Vegas for work and recommended this local gem!! Gem it was... packed to the gills and waited about 5-10 minutes for a table for 5.  Would wait even longer now that we have experienced their awesomeness! Local and casual... server never let our coffee get below half a cup, portions were huge and even through we were all tasting each other's tasty dishes, nobody could finish their own.  Breakfast tacos, pancakes, biscuits & gravy, chicken friend steak, all fantastic!!! Highly recommend, worth the wait and will definitely go back when we are in town!

j0EjVTLGnu6bHyQUkm4Y9Q.text: I ate here every morning when in vegas. Food what youd 3xpect from breakfast food. My only criticism is FoH is under staffed and it causes them frustration.

CnjG0GQyketCJpEipCB74Q.text: A group of us came in here for dinner and I will tell you, the service was absolutely horrible. It took so long to get drinks ordered and then our food ordered. On top of that some of our food didn't even come out right, like we had ordered it, so we had to wait even longer. They never came back with my lemons for my water. It took asking three different servers until we got what we asked for. I used to come to Blueberry Hill all the time when I was younger, but now, the food isn't as good and the service was really bad. I'm not surprised with how many people were actually dining there when we were there. None of the food was fantastic, mediocre at best. Our waitress didn't even seem like she wanted to be there. Everytime we asked her something, she didn't really have a direct answer for us. This location is definitely one that I don't care to go back to anytime soon.

lp9xQDekFIyhly-EQUWKmg.text: First time ordering chicken &waffles Yum! Food came hot and even the syrup was hot. Friendly server took good care of us.

nEsvoT8mwK4hATRtjXVP6g.text: This location is really nice inside compared to the others. Our waitress was really friendly, the service was prompt and the food was excellent. And they serve alcohol, I did not know that! I had the corned beef and hash breakfast plate and Baileys and coffee, yum. (Had this late night, breakfast for dinner) Nothing but good things to say about this location and I will definitely be returning :)

3n-Gc4a88L_VqulmKMRIUQ.text: Very nice place to have brunch with family. Its been a long time since I tried this place in the late 90's.. so far everything looks amazing.

fD9YR70CKG9_vfVGVdJuvQ.text: Was out in Vegas and wanted to dine in at a moms and pops diner and stumbled across this place. When I walked in I've noticed the place was pretty busy so it had to be good. Took us about 5 mins to be seated and we got a booth . They service everything you'll want to eat and cravings you'll have this place will have it all. I had the waffles with fresh fruits and boy it was delicious. The waffle batter was really good the waffle was nice, golden and crispy. The service was good. Our waitress was really nice and polite it was so much on the menu we couldn't decide   took a while to figure out what we wanna eat. They also bake fresh cakes, biscuits and etc if you want a home cooked meal away from the Vegas Strip this is your go to spot

FyMExZ217Dq3XiJTYpVElw.text: Can you say delish?  I was a little skeptical to try this place because of its location, but upon walking in, my mind was instantly changed.  It's more spacious than it looks from the outside and very clean and modern.  The food was amazing!  I ordered the chicken and waffles and it was a great take on what's usually a huge meal.  It was just the right amount of chicken and waffles and the breading on the chicken was delicious!  I would definitely return just for this!  They have a huge menu so there's a little something for everyone.  Service was decent and the server was friendly and helpful.

6TadTi4yvuObpLYzHt4R_Q.text: Love the place. Food is good and servers are wonderful. Very nice and friendly. We will definitely come back he to eat here.

CGGTu-a7PWZffpG6tvvc3w.text: I'm updating my review from the poor service last time. I absolutely love this place. The food has always been good, they have quite the extensive menu with different cuisines and they are all good. This morning I decided to be a badass and have several mimosas and breakfast sausage to get my day started right! My partner enjoyed his ham and hash browns. I'm always mesmerized by their cakes in their display cases and today is no exception. Their chocolate cream pie is to die for. I'm glad I came back, service was much better this this time!

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D4v22Bp6a1M-SCBwYuVXzQ.text: We stopped here the first morning as soon as we arrived in Las Vegas. We were all excited to try it based off of the reviews and photos. The service here was...eh. Our waitress was a little rude. My food didn't look the same as the photo. I ordered French toast. I absolutely hate whipped cream and in the pic there isn't whipped cream but there was on my order. I know its not a big deal but it was annoying and wrong.

Ct5jc6pVpmjw6jliBPx7hg.text: Wow can't believe I've lived in Vegas for 2 years and never heard of this place ! My fiance and I were looking for a good brunch place and ended up stumbling upon this gem. It's a really nice diner . We started off with a Bloody Mary and a Mimosa . The Bloody Mary was the best we have had out here ! Great spice and portions ! The mimosa was made with fresh squeezed oj also well proportioned with the champagne . I had the chicken and waffles the chicken was juicy and the waffle were fluffy, everything had great seasoning . My fiance had the omelette with the chunky potatoes . The potatoes were amazing they had that crisp bite into it . This has just become our new Sunday spot as there is so many things to try off the menu !

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary and mimosa !
Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles

YxPfQGobrnZ9LQZHopkqsA.text: FOOD IS AMAZING. They have a large menu and let you make substitutions on just about anything! We almost always order breakfast though! Very generous portions as well! Open 24/7 with all day breakfast ! Wait time on weekend mornings is reasonable - your not waiting there forever and the staff is quick moving to get people seated.   BUT - here is their down fall - the staff is always miserable. EVERY time we have been here our waitress looks like she hates her life. They are helpful and normally on the ball service wise but they are just absolutely miserable - not a single crack of a smile! Its a shame because the restaurant itself is a cute little place!

JCCoZfExdJ8Hy_6wXlGIBA.text: I actually came here back in April when my Mom was in town for my birthday. I live a few blocks from here but had never given it a try. We went in for breakfast on a Saturday around 9 in the morning, and the place had a really nice diner vibe with lots of people and great smelling food in the air. We were seated in a booth almost immediately, and had a really nice waitress who had the diner customer service (sassy :D)attitude down. We were very amused with her throughout our meal, and she answered all our menu questions with expertise. I got a blueberry muffin, still warm out of the oven, and a bacon salsa omelette thing that I can't remember the name of. Both were delicious. My mom got pancakes, and definitely bit off more than she could chew as the portions here are huge. The coffee was also quite good.   We liked it so much that we went back for breakfast on Monday around 7 before Mom flew out, and it was just a good of food. It was a different vibe as we were one of three parties in the place, but the waitress did a great job of making sure all were attended to and had plenty of coffee.   This place is definitely going to be a tradition when I have family visit in town, and I'm happy I found a nice laid back diner that I can take people to. Keep up the great work!

UP6hDbaz_bEVbT2tdWaQdQ.text: Ordered breakfast to be delivered via Grub Hub. Breakfast arrives & 4 full meals are missing. Never even got the chance to check the order because Grub Hub just dumped it at my office & took off. I called the restaurant Immediately. Female who took the call talk to the cook. I could hear the cooks say "yeah she messed up my order". Female on the phone said she could give me partial refund  but there was nothing she could do. If I wanted the food I would have to call GrubHub. This was after admitting that it was their mistake! Sad I won't be ordering from this restaurant again even if it's so close to my work and will customer service goes along way in building a relationship.

r_pfyAnKs-xvxdWx7YvB9w.text: Waited 20 minutes and had no one attend us on a Thursday after being seated.. I know you guys aren't that busy on a Thursday from the look of it. Oh, but a bigger group comes in after us and you guys are quick to attend them... just saying. And we aren't the only ones who weren't being serviced.  Everyone is running around wiping tables like they have a line of people waiting for a table...there wasn't. Look I work in customer service and the way the waitresses have no idea who has been served and who hasn't is sad and unprofessional. Sorry to say that you guys lost a few customers.

TY4OAttiTX13dbDeSUcshQ.text: Only been for breakfast. Shannon took good care of us today with great suggestions. Love the breakfast!! Not so much a fan of the hash brown or breakfast potatoes but love America cheese on the omelets. Pancakes are a bit too thick for me liking but waffles are great! We will be back!

oog__kSgrtgap0ZgkNe2qA.text: I think I would best describe this as a better Denny's.  The food is good and so was the service.  The pancakes were huge, anything more than the 3 is overkill.  The hash browns were not the best

267vYPA943Hvk2K5K4cmJA.text: The food was delicious and came out pretty fast. I had the chicken and waffles with apple compote and almost fell asleep after eating it. It was so worth it though! The service wasn't the best but the place is always packed. I highly recommend it!

H0XtNp7ZjezxOdn8Xzj83Q.text: The wait for our food was ridiculously long (at least it was good). The table next to us also had a long wait.  We were in the restaurant for almost an hour & a half.  Then when I told the manager after we ate, all he could say was "oh."  He even asked our waitress & she agreed that we had to wait a long time.  Guess I'll stick to the one on Decatur & Charleston!

QWFwy0wm6s5Z9HlLwIRdCw.text: I was worried with the star rating however. It was really delicious. My taco salad was great.  The waitress was nice. I was actually pretty happy with it all.

Sz1GmOksCC_P4BzqyVFX5A.text: The outside of this building is really plain and boring and I wouldn't have given this place much thought if I wasn't always near it. Much nicer on the inside than expected.   I ordered the Chicken Waffles to go. The chicken was ... there. Barely. But the waffles were really good!

L5bTuSVnnRb5vNeKma8L6Q.text: Great spot for breakfast and more.  Very extensive menu.  Nice location in the SW and close to the strip but with somewhat limited parking.  Sunday's can be really busy but as of yet when this review is written  and while this location is rather new, the weekdays are not that busy. This place reminded me of diners and family restaurants up in the Chicagoland area where I used to live.  It really had that big city vibe on that Sunday I went.  The countertop  seating  not facing the kitchen was a nice touch and is good for a solo dining experience and to do some B.S ing with the staff.  Had the vegetarian omelette which was fluffy, big and and tasty with 3 homemade pancakes as a side which were also fluffy and good.  The waitress was on top of it and often offered refills for the coffee.   Here what their site says:  "All our Beef is U.S.D.A. Certified Choice Beef Our Coffee is 100% Columbian, not a blend Our Eggs are Certified by the U.S.D.A as Grade AA, the highest in the industry for quality and safety, and are size extra-large. Fresh Blueberries Our Bacon and Sausage are 100% Oscar Mayer. Our orange juice is 100% pure juice, no water, no preservatives, never frozen, not from concentrate. All our fruit compotes are homemade in our kitchens, not from the can. Every fruit compote will be served with slices of fresh fruit on top. Strawberries when out of season will be frozen".  Next got try some of their coconut honey battered dishes.  Its sound great.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a3WtmG9T5Q4auohz9atB_Q.text: A very good brunch experience.  We had to wait a bit for a table, but everything was smooth and quick once we were seated.  The food was delicious and satisfying.

BT61ec3EKUWx-jEmyb-rpw.text: ***Check your credit card statement.  The server adds additional to his tip.  Checked my credit card statement and it charged more then what I signed for.  Will be calling the manager.

H9eHCfmw4VurXtEMjLuX0g.text: I give this place 2.5 stars really. In kinda neutral about it. They have a very large breakfast menu and if you aren't from Las Vegas this may be a place that you will lo ve to eat at but for me it wasn't worth the hype. I don't eat pork so it limits my breakfast options but when i went in i had the the chicken and waffles which was VERY disappointing. The waffle was good but the meat was horrible,  I don't even think i can honestly call it chicken, it was bland, and chewy i was actually scared to eat it. But I do give the manager credit because they noticed that I did not eat it and only charged me for a waffle. I don't think I will ever go back to eat at a Blueberry Hill just isn't the place for me.

WoICMVvQB-9tDvOA1EcC5w.text: This is a really good place for breakfast the muffins are made fresh every morning the service is pretty good ,and the staff is really friendly. It is a pretty relaxed atmosphere so not to busy not to loud.

Mwrl4YOxDLodpS2ETjSjog.text: Definitely a change of pace here compared to the strip. Tired of the same thing over and over again on the strip I took the time to look up something that was more like home. Stumbled upon Blueberry Hill and decided this was the spot. I was extremely surprised at what they had to offer. They have a huge no frills menu. Food is good and cheap, and they provide excellent service. Service was a big plus here, they  will actually speak to you and wait you unlike the service you receive on the strip. Will definitely make a stop here everytime I am in Vegas.

Qnn-FGQOI1HbCu4jNsJn1w.text: Really bad experience at this location today. We frequent their other locations with awesome service and food . Went for breakfast before catching a flight out. Service was very slow and order arrived cold and incorrect. They took the orders off the check but we really hadn't eaten so we ordered some pancakes which never came out after 20 minutes of waiting. So we left - couldn't miss our flight. I believe server was new as was the cook and the manager was vaguely apologetic. This place needs help!! Horrible way to start the morning!

WyAC04rkXykQJvqZCQx7Lg.text: After having so-so experiences at two other Blueberry Hill locations, I decided to give this new one a try, mainly because it's conveniently only a few blocks from home. I was impressed by the new style of the interior, much more modern than the other ones. Unfortunately that's where my being impressed stopped.  We seated ourselves and were attended to quickly enough. Our server, whose name escapes me now, wasn't really rude, just kinda snippy with us when we asked questions, like if I could have my burger with no onions. She said it doesn't come with onions and they had to be requested, and I pointed out the top of the burger page where it very clearly says that the burgers come "dressed with lettuce, tomato, grilled or raw onions and pickle", and she insisted I was reading it wrong and seemed to speak to me like I was a dummy. Whatever, I worked all night and I'm not looking for a debate for my breakfast/dinner, I just want to eat. We settled on the breakfast of champions: two orders of bacon cheeseburger & fries. As I sat waiting for my food, I noticed that my fork was pretty dirty. I really didn't want to be "that guy" and gripe about a dirty fork, especially because I wasn't going to use it anyway, so I cleaned it with a napkin and put it back. The server brought out our drinks and two glasses of water.   When the meals came out, I was really expecting more. For $9.59 I got a medium size burger on a slightly hard bun, and what seemed to be a handful of fries. On the side were 3 sad-looking pickle chips - I guess a whole pickle, or at least a lengthwise slice, would be too extravagant. Having dealt with BH before, I knew better than to ask for some cole slaw, because that's going on the bill. The food tasted good enough, but I really cannot justify paying almost $10 for a skimpy plate of mediocre food.  What really ruined the experience for me was when I finished my iced tea, and went to drink the glass of water. My glass, which I hadn't really paid any mind to until then, was filthy. Hopefully it wasn't dirt, just residue from their dish detergent, but I still wouldn't want to drink from it, even with a straw. By this time I was truly over BH, and still wasn't feeling like arguing, so we paid the tab and left. I mentioned to the cashier about the glass while we paid and she went in the kitchen and scolded someone as we were walking out the door.  Like the saying goes, you never get a second chance to make a first impression, so I can now say that I'm truly done with Blueberry Hill - if you need me, I'll be at the Black Bear stuffing myself on huge, worth-the-price portions and dealing with friendly people.

photos.caption: Photo of Blueberry Hill Family Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuck. Just yuck.

O7Atd96UL6aP00Fuf3I5SQ.text: This place is excellent! The food was delicious and it was reasonably priced. You get a lot of food for your money too. This was a great find outside of the strip and plan to return. Our waitress Alee was such a warm and funny person who really took care of us.

Y6toE4-pnqv1TzU45jRxeg.text: Came here due to it was literally in front of us & we had no idea what we wanted & were hungry.  Apon walking in they have a huge array of cakes of all flavors to entice your sweet tooth.  Place was quiet & waitress was very nice.. I was having a sugar attack & ordered a slice of coconut cake... My friend ordered meat loaf..the menu read Home cooking. It was a big mistake to assume "home style cooking"meant they made a good meat loaf...or dessert. The plate of food looked like cafeteria food. Nothing on it was the least bit appetizing. Granted meat loaf is rather ugly..food looked plastic & lifeless.  My slice of cake - dryyyy, The frosting was ok.. I was truly disappointed because their display case was really well done..We barely ate the food.  Place has a big menu.  Open 24 hours which may be the most useful thing about it, if you are absolutely starving ,on one & in need of something to put in your stomach. Mehhh..
