U-Cy_OAqLpFxsO8HWx3JOA.text: I liked it.  Service was somewhat slow and not especially attentive.  I ate some strange concoction that involved a grilled biscuit, topped with meat loaf, strips of bacon, served with a side of mashed potatoes and veg.  Everything was covered in a thick layer of country gravy.  It was a little spicy.  It was really good, but it was so heavy I was not able to eat for 6 hours - and I didn't even finish half.  We also had a pretty good pasta dish.   Unfortunately, the waitress didn't offer and desert so we just left although the deserts looked good in the case - mostly cakes.   I would try this place again, but I think I would split a meal.  The portion sizes are off the chart - which is a good thing.   The side dishes are a little wanting.  The steamed veg not so good.  Mashed potatoes not bad.  The county gravy needed more meat, but was passable.  The bacon was top notch.  The decor is basically a Marie Calendar's location that closed.  Traffic in and out of the parking lot is a nightmare.  The place is huge inside, but strangely laid out in odd seating sections.

lyXLXl6Nt83_QV4h04iOMg.text: I have been to a different blueberry hills location and it was a great expierence there. I brought my family to this location because it was close to the strip and we were hungry. I should have known this was going to be bad just from the fact there was not many people inside. The plates were dirty, the cups were dirty, the coffee was cold, abd and the server was rude and, apologies, incompetent. She did not get my husbands order right and never informed us that she had to have another burger made because it had been dropped supposedly. Needless to say it was ridiculous that we had to wait for his order.  Won't come back here and won't recommend it.

0j1Dt1K4HV2XyBLevZMebA.text: I had the biscuit and gravy 3-2-1 meal and it was amazing.  The portion of biscuit and gravy is what oh want them to be but never get;ginormous.  So amazingly delicious.  Definitely a unicorn of biscuits and gravy!!!!

0cJQ_DFQNIHQBAtkAUTyzQ.text: Surprised they're running a three-star average I'm rating it for what it is a franchise multiple location American type food featuring cuisine from Italian to Mexicans with above average homemade mass production food.  . I had the French toast and homemade hashbrowns yes homemade sweetie ordered the senior menu tina and fries.   $28 with coffee and soda.   Server named Wendy extremely pleasant and efficient.   Huge menu.

V2f90uH6wyzxgG4qtXWHQw.text: Super friendly staff and the prices are reasonable for the ridiculous amount of food on your plate.  Thank you Chantal & Lilly for your awesome service! The pancakes are super soft and fluffy, the corned beef hash cooked till the edges were just crispy and the waffle was fluffy and slight sweet! We'll be back!

yxXd0OriFec28jlmL7icig.text: Love, love the bluberry crepes. The have a great deal with a ham steak and eggs of your choice and two good size crepes with fruit for about 13 dollars. Also amazing customer service from the waitress, super friendly.

u8_jskz1WgoZyW8Gb0CugA.text: We were looking for a good breakfast place near the strip without either paying $1000 for breakfast or getting ebola from a buffet.  Thank you Yelp for helping us find this little gem.  The service was great, the food was great, and the location was awesome and near the strip.  We would definitely go back next time we are in Vegas.

OppAEtkRrwhOg9l1K4tP7A.text: My friends & I decided to check out this location because it is new.  The hostess sat us down & we skimmed our menu.  I ordered the Oreo pancakes & my two friends ordered a simple breakfast platter & fried chicken.  We waited almost an hour for our food. The old guy who got seated after us (he looked like a regular) got his food almost immediately along with a few more tables surrounding us.  The bar was empty so they were not that busy.  When we tried to ask for our waitress, the man we tried to flag down just ignored us thinking "you are not my table...."  All our food came out one at a time in about 5 minute increments.  My pancakes were still soggy/wet/uncooked in the middle.  The waitress asked us if there was anything else we needed to which I replied, "sugar-free syrup." I had to repeat myself because she did not listen the first time.  Overall, the long wait, the food being undercooked, the attitudes that the waitress & another worker gave us made the experience very upsetting.  I, along with my friends, will never go back to this place again!!!

nBge8W4crdDf7_hgo1z0_w.text: I heard great things about this place so I went and I was highly dissapointed. I ordered the eggs Benedict Florentine and they were the worst I ever had. The hollandaise sauce was flavorless, which makes up the dish. The English muffins were soggy. We also ordered a chicken omelette and the eggs were overcooked. How do you overcook eggs????  Besides for the food, there was an intoxicated patron inside laughing and being extremely loud. I would have expected an employee to tell him to keep it down or get him out. I'll give the restaurant the benefit of the doubt and say maybe I ordered the wrong plates. Highly disappointed tho.

0TVdLSJG9YR7EUb5WR8aaw.text: Best French toast ever!  Love the combo omelet with salsa!  Great Place.  Enjoyed our server.
